jobDescription: Job Description Data clearly shows that previous Intel interns make the most successful new hires and when hired into full time roles, generally perform better and can be promoted more quickly and have a longer tenure. Recognizing Return On Investment (ROI) when we see it, Intel Finance has committed itself to identifying talented student interns, providing them with high quality, real world problems to solve in a structured and supportive environment. Interns are assigned projects with the responsibility for providing varying levels of financial information and analysis to operational business groups, business leaders, or factory managers to help assist and/or drive the business decision making process. Your internship will culminate with a final presentation to senior managers/leaders to describe your project, demonstrate depth of analysis, and make recommendations for finance to implement. You can expect an action packed summer different than you have ever experienced as you immerse yourself in a program rich with professional development opportunities, learning opportunities, and a lot of fun along the way! Activities like white water rafting, happy hours, hiking, team dinners, and trips to the beach or mountains, give you the time and space you need to think clearly, connect with fellow interns and co-workers, and perform at your peak in your internship. Project Responsibilities Will Include But Not Be Limited To Providing general information and counsel in the areas of pricing, cost, marketing strategies, return on investment decisions and the development of overall business plans and strategies. Ensuring compliance with financial reporting requirements and corporate policies to ensure the integrity of external and internal reporting. Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal and on the job training, experience and judgment. Assist in process optimization efforts to achieve more effective and efficient business processes. Engaging with a variety of stakeholders across business groups to better develop the scope of your project and planned recommendation. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Must be pursing an MA or MBA with an emphasis in Finance, Economics or Accounting. Experience with financial statements and their inter relationships. Experience with Microsoft Office Suite of tools including Excel, PowerPoint and Word. 2+ years of applicable full time work experience This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. Inside this Business Group As members of the Finance team, employees act as full partners in making and supporting business decisions that are aimed at maximizing shareholder value. Intel Finance has a strong focus on facilitating change and improvement both within finance and in the operations supported. Other Locations US,NM,Albuquerque;US,OR,Hillsboro;US,CA,Folsom;US,CA,Santa Clara Covid Statement Intel strongly encourages employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Intel aligns to federal, state, and local laws and as a contractor to the U.S. Government is subject to government mandates that may be issued. Intel policies for COVID-19 including guidance about testing and vaccination are subject to change over time. jobTitle: AI Research Scientist Internship - Trusted Media Intern
jobDescription: Job Description Responsibilities may be quite diverse of a technical nature. U.S. experience and education requirements will vary significantly depending on the unique needs of the job. Job assignments are usually for the summer or for short periods during breaks from school. Geometric, Generative, and Good AI Team in Intelligent Systems Research Lab, Intel Labs conducts inter-disciplinary research for unraveling AI for humans to amplify human potential in physical and digital worlds, by creating trustworthy AI systems; AI-ficiation of complex problems; and reconstructing, animating, and securing digital personas. Research topics root from computational geometry, computer vision, and signal processing methods in 2D and 3D, to formulate problems in the specific domain and to build AI-based novel perspectives using the priors of that domain. We conduct fundamental and applied research in the context of vertical domains including manufacturing, media, enterprise, metaverse, and assistive computing. Intel Labs is an industry-leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline, product innovations, and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high-risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units. G3 AI Team is looking for a motivated summer intern with experience at the intersection of machine learning and computer vision domains who can collaborate on research projects being conducted in one or more of G3 AI's focus areas. The successful candidate will be working on developing responsible AI approaches related to the integrity of digital content, including manipulated content detection, synthetic data generation, media provenance, and adversarial attacks on such systems, with one or more of modalities such as vision, audio, speech, or physiology. Current projects span across vertical domains like manipulated media identification using biological priors, novel neural network architectures for responsible generation, or integrating media provenance to AI algorithms. In this position you will have the opportunity to conduct independent research on building multimodal learning systems and applications. Typical work would span across exploring signals and priors of different domains, data curation and database ingestion, developing, optimizing and deploying deep learning models within different domains, and developing and applying model interpretation methods to support decision making. You will be researching fundamental concepts and methods for exploiting authenticity and fakery signals in manipulated media, building and evaluating systems and proofs-of-concept that will allow for the deployment of scalable approaches in real settings. This research will enable internal technology transfers and publication of findings in both internal and external venues. In addition to the research collaterals, building proof of concept prototypes is also expected from the candidate. Qualifications You must possess the below requirements to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork and/or classes and/or research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Minimum Qualifications The candidate must hold a B.S degree and be pursuing a Ph.D. program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any related field. 1+ year experience in below areas: Deep Learning and Computer Vision, i.e., Generative Models, Image and Signal Processing, Multimodal Artificial Intelligence, Interpretable Machine Learning Novel architectures beyond convolutional networks, such as transformers, attention modules, generative adversarial networks, conditional autoencoders, diffusion models AI frameworks (e.g., Pytorch, TensorFlow, Keras, Caffe) Python and/or C++ languages Data analysis, statistical methods, and algorithm evaluation Preferred Qualifications Publications in top DL/CV/AI/CG venues such as CVPR, ICCV, PAMI, NeurIPS, SIGGRAPH. Experience in Deep Learning based techniques at the intersection of Vision, Audio, and Physiology Knowledge of Computer Vision techniques such as object detection, recognition, segmentation, tracking, and reconstruction Knowledge of Generative Models such as GANs, Variational Autoencoders, and Blend Shapes Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques such as Adversarial Learning, Probabilistic methods, Physics-based Models, and Model Adaptation Experience in Signal Processing techniques beyond audio-visual domain, such as PPG, EEG, and MRI Knowledge of black-box Model Interpretability techniques for explaining model predictions and using the black-box models for designing Adversarial Attacks Behavior Traits Proven track record of collaboration and technical leadership to deliver leading-edge solutions Verbal communication, technical writing, and presentation skills. Work Model for this Role This role is available as remote position (work-from-home) and would require you to visit Intel sites based on business need. This is an internship position and compensation will be given accordingly. Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research. Inside this Business Group Enable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software. Job Description The Design Implementation for Customers using Structured ASIC technology Team within Intel's Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) is looking for a senior level ASIC Integration Engineer. As a senior level ASIC Integration Engineer, you will interact with customers to collect information on RTL and IP and implement the customer code through synthesis, PnR, timing closure, and hand off layout database to the tape out team. As An ASIC Integration Engineer, You Will Perform Logic design for integration of cell libraries, functional units, and subsystems into SoC full chip designs, Register Transfer Level coding, and simulation for SoCs. Contribute to the development of multidimensional designs involving the layout of complex integrated circuits. Perform all aspects of the SoC design flow from high-level design to synthesis, place and route, timing, and power to create a design database that is ready for manufacturing. Develop environment and infrastructure for automation solutions in ASIC implementation flow. May also review vendor capability to support development. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications The candidate must have a Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 5+ years of experience in the following areas: Design Compiler (RTL to Netlist Synthesis) and/or Static Timing Analysis (STA) (PrimeTime) Scripting language (TCL, Python, Perl, or Shell) Preferred Qualifications 8+ years of experience in synthesis, timing, and one or more of the following: Cross Clock Domain analysis (Spyglass) DDR timing closure methodology RTL coding or SOC integration Place and Route Tools Python scripting Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. jobTitle: Associate General Counsel, Senior Director and Head of Corporate Securities and Governance
jobDescription: Job Description In this position, you will report directly to the Company's Vice President, Head of Corporate Legal and will provide primary legal support to Intel's external reporting and corporate secretarial functions. You will be responsible for all legal matters related to compliance with federal and state securities laws and the applicable rules and regulations of Nasdaq. You will also manage a team of legal professionals responsible for corporate governance, including management and administration of board and committee meetings, stockholder engagement and ESG. You will also advise the Disclosure Committee and Audit Finance Committee of the Board on key disclosure matters and partner with the finance team on enterprise risk management. In this position, strong technical and advisory skills, excellent business judgment, people management skills, project management skills, the ability to effectively team with business groups throughout Intel and your management of outside counsel will be among the more important keys to your success. The issues you will have to address will require real-time analysis and practical advice. You must be able to work under significant pressure and maintain a sense of patience, camaraderie, and respect. You will join Intel's team of highly experienced corporate attorneys and work closely with the Intel's Chief Legal Officer and Corporate Secretary and members of Intel's finance and legal teams worldwide. Qualifications You should possess at least 12-15+ years of general corporate legal experience gained at both law firms and in-house, with subject matter expertise in public company securities compliance and corporate governance. Qualifications Include Significant experience preparing and reviewing SEC filings, including periodic and current reports, Section 16 filings and proxy statements. Ability to provide real-time advice on securities law issues, including review of earnings, press releases, scripts and investor presentations, as well advising on Reg FD compliance and insider trading policy matters. Experience supporting a public company board of directors and committees, including preparing and reviewing materials and preparation of minutes, consents, charters and policies. Experience with investor relations, proxy advisory firms and the annual meeting process. An in-depth understanding of Intel's business and strategy and its associated risks and opportunities. Excellent project management skills. Prior in-house legal management experience. Ability to effectively communicate with the executive leadership team. Well-rounded corporate legal expertise in multiple areas, including M&A and strategic investments. Inside this Business Group Intel’s Growth Acceleration Team (GAT) offers unique opportunities to work in a variety of areas, including counsel to Intel businesses; technology and intellectual property licensing; patent prosecution; trademarks and brands; litigation, mergers, acquisitions and investing; public policy, legislative and regulatory lobbying; global trade, export, import, and customs; and corporate compliance. jobTitle: ATTD Manufacturing Equipment Technician – Portland Community College Quick Start Semiconductor Training Program
jobDescription: Job Description Intel products are transforming the lives of everybody on Earth! Our fabrication facilities are full of world-leading technologies, and we are looking for manufacturing equipment technicians who are excited to problem solve and maintain some of the most advanced machines on the planet. On our team, you will become an expert in a variety of technical and manufacturing skills, from operations to equipment repair and troubleshooting in a production environment. Intel invests in its people just as much as its technology. Learn more about Life at Intel here: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/jobs/life-at-intel.html Your day-to-day schedule will be full of amazing opportunities. As a Manufacturing Equipment Technician, you will be: Operating, maintaining, and repairing, and troubleshooting specialized processing equipment inside a clean room environment Collecting data and communicating results to engineering teams to optimize equipment and process Performing complex tasks such as equipment installation, qualification, and troubleshooting Solving problems with impact on factory performance and efficiency A Successful Candidate Must Be Willing To Regularly lift loads up to 25 lbs. Wear closed toe shoes for the duration of shift. Walk 3-5 miles and stand or sit for up to 9 hours within a shift. Push carts for a distance of at least 500 m Climb and perform work on ladders or at heights. Spend the majority of work time (more than 90% less break time) in a clean room environment working on tool sets, processing wafers, and standing or sitting for extended periods of time. Work in a clean room environment wearing a gown, hood, booties, safety glasses and gloves for the duration of shift, with the possibility of using airline-supplied respirators Work on a night or day shift compressed work week schedule. Shifts are twelve hours long and alternate between three and four days a week. Perform detailed inspection tasks. Use job specific fixtures, basic hand tools, and potentially airline supplied respirators. Additional Notes This job posting is applicable for entry level Manufacturing Technician and compensation will be adjusted accordingly. This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship Qualifications Minimum Education Requirement High school diploma or equivalent, to be completed by employment start date Successful completion of Portland Community College Quick Start Semiconductor Training Preferred Qualifications Experience with maintenance, repair, or troubleshooting equipment including inspection tasks Experience in interpreting schematics and drawings or diagrams Experience with using basic tools and potentially airline supplied respirators Experience using computer and general computer programs Covid Statement Intel strongly encourages employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Intel aligns to federal, state, and local laws and as a contractor to the U.S. Government is subject to government mandates that may be issued. Job Description Intel Finance prides itself on creating an environment where you are challenged to become the most well rounded, effective finance professional you can be. When you join Intel Finance, you can expect to support both brilliant technologists and top finance leaders who are working to change the world by creating leading edge technology. Business Process Owner (BPO) is a key role within the Finance Corporate Controller's (CCO) Global Process Owner (GPO) Office responsible for definition, design, implementation, and adoption of Record to Report (R2R) processes, systems and policies for specific domain areas across the global organization to be consistent with CCO's five operating principles: accountability, transparency, optimization, scale, and employee experience. The candidate is responsible for global process and systems standardization and optimization, and accelerating automation of specific domain areas in the R2R function while adhering to standard functionality from a suite of current, agile, and flexible ERP and EPM applications that leverage a unified data model. The BPO will play a critical role in delivering the GPO's modernization vision and priorities as we transform the way we deliver back-office support, building flexible solutions to support the business today and in the future. Key Responsibilities Strategy and Policy: For specific domain areas will support CCO operations and the GPO office by gathering data from and understanding the R2R organization, Intel business, and other Intel stakeholder requirements; define objectives and standards for policy, processes, systems and data to meet such requirements; develop the global process structure, governance and ownership, including operational goals and objectives following a single best global standard practice for each process stream; will partner with the operations delivery lead to ensure the execution of the processes is consistent with standards and expectations; and monitor and report on process performance in meeting stakeholder requirements and key benchmarks. Process Design: Understands the end to end process(es) standards, data hierarchy, variations, pain points, systems, and control environment, and can translate this knowledge into deliverables and plans that meet objectives; and understands the as-is state, define the desired to-be state and identify process improvement opportunities to streamline, eliminate, standardize and automate process for specific domain areas within the R2R function by aligning and collaborating closely with R2R operations and other stakeholders to achieve desired end state. Digital Sensing: For specific domain areas defines and designs the R2R system and process foundation to be flexible, agile, and responsive to changing business paradigms utilizing a standard suite of integrated applications based upon a unified data model that provides stakeholders with a simplified experience and an ability to access real time data via self-service analytics and reporting. Remains abreast of relevant emerging technologies and other digital solutions; and establishes connections and collaborates with other functional process and IT teams. Organization Capability: Defines critical business process acumen for specific domain areas, assesses organization knowledge/skills, orchestrates process and business acumen training to develop and sustain key capabilities for the organization to meet objectives Success In The Role Requires The Following Subject Matter Expertise: Deep understanding of General Ledger, chart of accounts, financial master data, end-to-end R2R processes and systems/technology in responsible domain areas as well activities upstream from our general ledger that can impact performance, quality, or throughput of R2R execution and downstream to EPM and business intelligence systems. Planning and Disciplined Execution: Leverage deep subject area expertise to plan, prioritize, resource, and deliver process improvement efforts for domain areas based on the understanding of R2R strategic objectives, upcoming business model shifts and related enterprise initiatives. Process Improvement and Design: Apply best practice process design methods to make informed recommendations regarding process standardization and how best to improve it with best practices and emerging technologies. Problem-solving: Identify core process breakdowns, analyze potential causes. Prioritize pain points and identify options to implement the most effective solutions. Understand customer needs and innovate to serve and solve customer and business needs - rationalized for what is essential for the organization. Business Partnering: Build strong relationships with other BPO's and teams to align priorities, synchronize process improvement plans, lead, and engage the right experts to design across functions, and influence recommended changes to optimize the end-to-end process. Change Management: Define change impacts, understand the organization's ability to absorb change and take deliberate action to ensure stakeholders and service delivery teams are ready and able to implement changes smoothly and consistently across the globe. Communication skills: Ability to effectively communicate across multiple stakeholders including IT, accounting, and other stakeholders. Ability to summarize and present to GPO's and other leaders. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's or Master's degree with 10+ years of experience in Accounting. 5+ years of relevant experience working closely within an enterprise's ERP instance, preferably SAP, and related initiatives. This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. Inside this Business Group As members of the Finance team, employees act as full partners in making and supporting business decisions that are aimed at maximizing shareholder value. Intel Finance has a strong focus on facilitating change and improvement both within finance and in the operations supported. Description: We are looking for software engineers to develop, test, deploy and support factory automation systems that enable Intel to manufacture leading edge semiconductors. Ideal candidate must possess a Bachelor or Master of Science degree in Engineering or Computer Science with strong software skills with at least 7 years’ experience in software development. Your responsibilities will include but not limited to: - Designing, developing, testing and deploying windows software applications (working in all tiers of the application) - Working closely with project managers, technical lead, peer developers and customers local and across geos. - Ability to work cross culturally and cope with different time zones. - Software development in C#, T SQL programming, WCF and Rest services - Strong foundation and understanding of software engineering, programming concepts and principles. - Proficiency in written and spoken English, excellent communication, analytical and problem solving skills to articulate problem statement and solution effectively. 7+ years experience min Bachelors

Job Description As a CAD Research Intern in the Design Enablement Test Chip Engineering (TCE) group, you will be responsible for the research and development of CAD software tools and flows, methodologies, and processes to support the design of Intel's next generation process technology test chips. Your Responsibilities Will Include But Not Be Limited To Development of CAD software/flows that automate physical layout of E-Test Structure devices and connectivity, layout dummification, design verification within a customized physical design framework Definition of process design rules to make designs conform to process requirements Collaborating with other manufacturing groups to define test structure designs Troubleshoot design and DRC verification issues with complex physical designs flows and tools Develop software to increase automation and productivity The candidate is expected to work closely with the team but carry out research, development, and test tasks with minimal supervision This is an internship position and compensation will be given accordingly. This is a 3-6 month internship. Qualifications You must possess the below requirements to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork and/or classes and/or research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Minimum Qualifications Pursuing a Masters or Ph.D. degree in Electrical, Computer science, or other related engineering discipline 6+ months of experience in following areas: One of the following: Python, Perl, Tcl, SKILL, C++ Solving problems using efficient computer algorithm and effective programming techniques UNIX/Linux or Shell Experience with industry standard CAD tools for schematic entry, circuit simulation, custom layout, and design/layout verification, from vendors such as Cadence, Synopsys, and Siemens. Preferred Qualifications A Ph.D. candidate with research experience in physical design or CAD Experience in development of PCells or PyCells Experience in Calibre SVRF and/or Cadence SKILL languages Experience in developing custom flows for EDA Tools using AI/ML concepts Semiconductor device physics and process scaling Inside this Business Group As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art -- from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology Development and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore’s Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth. Job Description This is an exciting time to be at Intel - come join our Chipsets Ingredients Team which is part of the Chipsets Silicon Group (CSG). Intel is transforming and so is CSG. Here at CSG we create products that empower people to live a better life. We at CIT are looking for a highly motivated logic/RTL design engineer who will be responsible for the definition and implementation of clocking solution for client and server chipsets in cutting edge internal and external technology nodes. In this unique role the scope of learning opportunities, contributions and influence expands over on-die, multi-die and system level clocking solutions. As system level clocking protocols are the backbone of modern multi-die power management schemes, the role naturally expands into great exposure and contribution opportunities into low-power architecture and design. You will be responsible for the development of all new clocking IPs for the various market segments that CSG caters across Intel. Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to one or more of the following aspects of the design flow which encompasses all aspects of logic design methodology Feature feasibility study, performance analysis and micro architecture of latest feature requirement Digital design of a wide variety of logic functions, with emphasis on multi-clock and multi-power domain designs Register Transfer Level (RTL) HDL design feasibility, development and debug Co-development of design test plan and validation strategy with validation team Providing IP integration support to SoC customers Behavioral Traits We Are Looking For Technical leadership with good communication, interpersonal and problem solving skills Motivated, self-directed and willing to work effectively both independently and as a team Qualifications Minimum Qualifications The candidate must possess a Bachelors in Electrical, Computer or any engineering related field and 3+ years of experience or Master's degree in Electrical, Computer or any engineering related field with 2+ years of experience in: Microprocessors, computer system architecture VLSI design Digital state machine architecture and logic design RTL quality checks (Lintra, CDC, VCLP) Simulation-based debug (VCS, Verdi, DVE) Exposure to Static Timing Analysis, timing convergence and synthesis Inside this Business Group In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power Intel’s products. From development, to integration, validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s Law and groundbreaking innovations. DEG is Intel’s engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as well as other engineering teams. As a critical provider of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient and effective manner. Job Description Join us to lead the next generation of Intel cloud security. Intel is on a quest to create world-changing technology that improves the life of every person on the planet. Our Security First pledge states that our customers’ security is an ongoing priority. As Intel builds out cloud-based services, Security First and security by default will be a prime concern. We are a new and vibrant team in Intel’s Software & Advanced Technology Group working with a true startup mentality. Join us as cloud security architect to architect and implement cutting edge cloud security solutions which leverage IPUs to separate tenant from infrastructure traffic, leveraging service mesh, Vault secret management, etc. Conduct the right security scans, identifying opportunities to bring AI into the picture to detect intrusions, scan for vulnerabilities, etc. Join us as we build out our new cloud capabilities, everything from BMaaS, IaaS, CaaS up to the various SaaS solutions that we are building. Job Description This is a hands-on technical position, with a mixture of architecture, design and implementation: Develop architecture for security in Intel’s cloud services. Define and prototype security mechanisms and contribute to threat model development for a diverse product portfolio in Intel’s cloud offerings. Assess all potential attack vectors throughout the product lifecycle and mitigating through architecting mechanisms, establishing internal policies, and monitoring. Engage with ecosystem partners to bring advanced new ways of securing our cloud offerings based on industry's best and standard practices. Proliferate robust security principles through your technical contributions and evangelization into our organization work-practices, including threat modeling, secure code reviews, fuzzing & penetration testing, rapid resolution of security defects and promote Hackathon activities. Respond to customer/client requests or events as they occur. Actualize knowledge of state-of-the-art security principles, theories and attacks and proactively mitigate security vulnerabilities. Influence, technically, cloud design teams, software products, industry spec committees, peers, and managers. Contribute to the development of intellectual property Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Experience would be obtained through a combination of relevant previous job and/or internship experience. Minimum Qualifications Candidate must have a Masters with a minimum of 10 years of industry experience or a PhD degree with a minimum of 7 years of relevant industry experience. Preferred Qualifications 10+ years of industry experience in one or more of the following: CyberSecurity for data centers, clouds and cloud-based services Data privacy In-depth understanding of security concepts, such as threat modelling, security lifecycle, secure HW/SW architecture, and design, knowledge of cryptographic application (algorithms, usage etc.), security implication of various cloud services. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Motivated “self-starter” capable of collaborating across organizational boundaries. Inside this Business Group Enable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software. Job Description Want to be part of a team that enables amazing computing experiences with software and shape the way people think about computing? In this role you will get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our engineers work across the entire software stack, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. In this role you will have an opportunity to work with container technologies and meet the growing demand for Containers as a Service across IT and Intel. We are looking for individuals who are ready to put their skills to test, take on the challenging yet fulfilling endeavor and collaborate as a team. You will be part of dedicated software team who will be responsible for designing a scalable, secure, high performance core service layer, integrating it with the cloud orchestration and monitoring, authoring the code and automating the deployment (CI/CD). Responsibilities Would Include The Following Own end to end development, maintain and manage the codebase Participate in code reviews, setting up the development standards and practices Make high level design choices focused on manageability, scalability, resiliency, and security Qualifications Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent 5+ years of design and development experience for large scale distributed systems/cloud core services using Go language Expertise in Web Services protocols such as REST, gRPC and API design for extensibility and portability Strong foundation on application software and system software concepts Strong foundation with Linux operating system Strong experience and working knowledge in Kubernetes Strong scripting skills e.g., Python, Shell, Ruby, Perl, other. Strong problem-solving skills coupled with a strong aptitude and desire to learn and innovate. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of Cloud Environments such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, OpenStack, etc Knowledge of virtualization technologies e.g. VMWare, KVM, VirtualBox. Basic knowledge of SQL Databases, e.g. MySQL and PostgreSQL Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research. #golang #kubernetes #scripting #cloud #virtualization Inside this Business Group Intel's Information Technology Group (IT) designs, deploys and supports the information technology architecture and hardware/software applications for Intel. IT is also responsible for e-Commerce development, data hosting and delivery of Web content and services. Job Description Join Intel-and build a better tomorrow. Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a vision to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. So join us-and help us create the next generation of technologies that will shape the future for decades to come. About The Role Research Engineers are responsible for leading scientific research enabling manufacture of innovative device and packaging architectures coupled with the realization of these architectures. Your Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To Investigate the feasibility of applying scientific principles and concepts to potential inventions and products typically 5+ years prior to landing on a product roadmap. Initiate and drive the design, development, execution and implementation of scientific and engineering research projects in both fab and laboratory environments to fuel Intel's growth in the areas of computing, communication, technology, and manufacturing and new business opportunity. Operate fabrication line in order to integrate the many individual steps necessary for the manufacture of complex microprocessors. Collaborate with equipment suppliers to develop new equipment necessary to exploit the understanding gained in research by identifying shortcomings, proposing and evaluating hardware modifications to mitigate issues. Participate in the transfer of viable technology options to the internal technology development team. Maintain substantial knowledge of state-of-the-art principles and theories, and contributes to technical literature and conferences. Participate in development of intellectual property. The Successful Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits Be self-motivated Committed Enthusiastic Able to work in a team We're constantly working on making a more connected and intelligent future, and we need your help. Change tomorrow. Start today. Qualifications You must possess the below requirements to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork and/or classes and/or research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Minimum Requirements PhD in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Materials Science or related discipline 2+ years experience with advanced engineering disciplines such as math, statistics, physics, chemistry and programming language 2+ years Semiconductor Device characterization and data analysis/modeling or 2+ years Semiconductor device fabrication and physical characterization Preferred Requirements Demonstrated experience in the following areas: Emphasis in Solid State Material and Semiconductor Device Physics, Digital and Analog Circuit Design and Analysis, CMOS Process Technology Electrical circuit design/debug/characterization Proficient in coding/scripting language (C/C++/python/Matlab) Hands-on experience with electrical test equipment such as oscilloscope, pulse generator, semiconductor parameter analyzer (CV-IV), and controlling software Proficiency in design of experiment, statistical analysis methods and analysis software, such as JMP Inside this Business Group As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art -- from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology Development and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore’s Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth. jobTitle: CPU Arithmetic HW Formal Verification Engineer
jobDescription: Job Description In this role you will be you part of the Intel E-Core arithmetic hardware formal verification team, which is part of Intel's Design Engineering Group (DEG). Ideally you should have expertise in formal methods of verification including automated theorem proving. Experience in arithmetic methods of hardware implementation are a great benefit. You will be in charge of the verification of arithmetic designs for future Intel E-Core products, as well of the definition and development of the verification infrastructure. You are expected to be independent and creative with the ability to innovate new solutions and demonstrate uncompromised quality during your work Qualifications Minimum Requirements: PhD in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering with emphasis on formal verification OR M.S. in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering with relevant education or work experience OR B.S. in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering plus 4 years of relevant work experience. Specialization in formal verification is highly desirable. Additional Qualifications Include Good communication and interaction skills are required. Strong software skills Experience in industry or academic formal verification tools Experience in working with Verilog / System Verilog Assertions Familiarity with CPU architecture/assembly Inside this Business Group In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power Intel’s products. From development, to integration, validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s Law and groundbreaking innovations. DEG is Intel’s engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as well as other engineering teams. As a critical provider of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient and effective manner. jobTitle: CPU Core Low Power Design Engineer
jobDescription: Job Description In this position, you will be responsible for CPU Power/Performance measurements, debug and optimization and Leading/Managing a Cross-geo Team driving power convergence across multiple products. Your Responsibilities Will Include But Not Be Limited To Drive power measurements and identify areas for improvement at various levels: arch, Uarch, RTL, SD and others. Leading Architecture, Design, IP COEs and validation teams for Power/Perf debug and optimization. Lead/improve power measurement/optimization tools that are needed for co-optimization of power and timing. Direct Management of Power Team working optimization/projection/co-relation Influencing the future products with Si learnings and provide multi-layered technical expertise for next generation initiatives. The Ideal Candidate Should Also Exhibit The Following Good problem-solving skills, Leadership skills. Managerial skills. Attention to detail. Willingness to multitask, work in a dynamic and team oriented environment. Excellent interpersonal skills, including strong written and verbal communication skills. Job Description Intel's Accelerated Computing and Graphics (AXG) group is on an exciting journey to deliver unprecedented computing power to everyone. As a new business within Intel, this is an opportunity to help influence and shape how the Accelerator and Solutions Customer Engineering team provides enabling, advocacy and support for our OEM and ODM customers as they develop, validate and launch server systems that include Intel GPU products and IFL custom accelerator products. The Customer HW Engineer reports into the Accelerator and Solutions Customer Hardware Engineering team This is an Intel Federal Position. In this role, you would provide customer enabling support for Intel Federal (IFL) products and ensure customer success in deploying them. Responsibilities Include, But Not Limited To, The Following Representing customer requirements and preferences through advocacy within Intel, into various teams that develop, validate, and deploy products Providing design-in support and information to customers while developing a trusted-advisor relationship with their engineering teams to ensure customer success in the development and launch of Intel product-based products Creating tools and collateral to help make customers' work easier and faster, and make your own work more impactful at scale Developing technical presentations for the customer and running customer technical meetings Providing technical support for your customer including hands on debug or assisting them with problem solving issues on their product including collaborating with cross-functional engineering and business teams to drive solutions for customers Other and may include writing white papers, developing new product requirements or specifications, lab management, ordering and managing equipment, running product experiments and pilots, and issue database management Travel for customer visits may be required, when needed. Behavioral Skills Desired Customer Obsessed - Motivated to drive customer success across technical and organizational boundaries and ability to identify and resolve both customer technical and relationship issues independently One Intel - Collaborative team player with strong interpersonal skills Fearless - Ability to adapt and operate in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment with a strong sense of task prioritization to maximize impact Truth and Transparency - Ability to clarify and drive vague or unclear requirements, and excellent communication (verbal and written) with past experience writing documentation and delivering training presentations Inclusion - Ability to bring out the best in the team and others through supportive, positive role-modeling. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications A Bachelor's Degree in Electrical/Computer or Electronic Engineering, Computer Science or directly related field with 3+ years of relevant experience. Or, a Masters Degree in the same field with 2+ years relative experience. Or a PhD in the same field. Experience In One, Or More Of The Following Areas Intel architecture systems, chipsets or accelerators Validation and debug, signal integrity analysis, power/thermal management, or printed circuit board design Experience with interfaces like; PCI-Express, DDR4/5 memory interface, SMBUS OR JTAG Preferred Skills And Experience Working directly with customers and/or providing technical support for a product Influencing, and working with multiple engineering and business teams Platform schematic and/or printed circuit board layout tools and methodologies Experience with platform testability architecture and tools i.e. JTAG/BDSL, C-scripts Experience with Intel Signal Integrity simulation tool like IMLC IMADC ICAT or other EDA tools like ADS, Hspice, Sigrity etc. This position involves work on a US Government Contract. Applicants may be required to provide proof of citizenship in order to comply with US government requirements. Any offer by Intel for this position is conditioned upon satisfying any proof of citizenship to meet US government requirements. Inside this Business Group The focus of Accelerated Computing Systems and Graphics (AXG) is to accelerate our execution in strategic growth areas of high-performance computing and graphics. AXG is chartered with delivering high performance computing and graphics solutions (IP, Software, Systems), for both integrated and discrete segments across client, enterprise and data center. Our mission is to make zeta-scale computing accessible to every human on the planet by the end of this decade and to entertain, educate and connect billions of people with buttery smooth visual experiences. Job Description As a Intel Customer Success Solutions Architect working with the Customer Success Team. We have the ability to directly impact successful customer adoption of Amber Technologies. We are responsible for the development of the technical vision and solution that meets the customer’s needs and advising on business transformation with the aim of aligning people, process, and technology. You will build a trusted advisor relationship with our customers. You will work in close collaboration with Program Management and Engineering to influence the direction of Intel’s products. You will provide technical thought leadership for Amber emerging products for internal teams and for our Intel customers relative to their Amber strategies. You will be a member of a high-octane, high performing global team that will demand your best and provide the most fulfilling work of your career. You will be part of a team of architects who provide assistance on complex technical, enterprise, and security architectures. Job Role And Responsibilities Build and develop customer solutions based on current hands-on knowledge of the Intel product line. Specific technical depth needed on Amber related solutions such as: confidential computing attestation, SGX, public/private keys, K8’s and scripting, as well as third-party security products from Intel’s partner ecosystem. Design and present technical concepts and specific solutions to internal and external audiences of varying technical capabilities in a clear, concise and easily understood manner. Build technical design documentation and explain deep confidential computing concepts to technical buyers (e.g. CISO, Head of compliance, and their technical teams, etc.). Apply creative thinking/approach to figure out technical solutions that further business goals and align with corporate technology strategies, keeping in mind performance, reliability, scalability, usability, security, flexibility, and cost. Deliver architectural advise and oversight into integration with third party products within customer’s IT environment. Advise customers on Amber related operational readiness matters such as: Financial controls, Service Orientation, Operations Control, and Infrastructure Control. Define and promote the adoption of best practices of Intel products across the user community Contribute to the company’s strategic objectives by finding opportunities for product, people, and process improvement. Build and maintain the confidence of sales, engineering managers, and customers. Looking have ability to work in a fast pace environment demonstrating autonomy in conforming to strategic intent while adhering to team values at all times Qualifications 10+ years of relevant IT experience (security background, Amber/ML infrastructure, analytics, HA/DR, databases) 5+ years experience in customer-facing positions as a professional services consultant, preferably with an IT software or hands-on consulting organization 3+ years experience in architecting, designing and deploying cloud services (Azure, AWS, etc.) products or solutions Technical knowledge of various MS Windows operating systems and database solutions including scripting with Powershell, VBScript, registry hacking, automated deployment techniques, and driver integration Excellent communications and social skills, especially public speaking and presentation skills Ability to travel up to 30% or more throughout home region (and occasionally internationally). B.S./B.A./M.S. degree or equivalent technical training Inside this Business Group Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions. jobTitle: Data Platforms Group Summer Undergrad Internship
jobDescription: Job Description Come intern for one of the largest semiconductor companies in the world! The Data Platforms Group (DPG) summer internship program is an immersive experience for students looking to build their technical skill and learn about Intel's Data Platforms Group business. About The Data Platforms Group The Data Platforms Group (DPG) is at the heart of Intel's transformation from a PC company to a company that powers the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing-devices. The data center is the hub for every data-driven service - from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing that fuels the cloud, communication, enterprise, and governments around the world. About This Role Students hired into this program will spend 12 weeks working with the Data Platforms Group, alongside one of our world-class teams. Internship assignments will range from working with on customer centric solutions, smart connected devices at the edge, silicon development, 5G and data center connectivity, strategy, marketing, business planning and more. Internship focus will vary in nature from software, hardware, and business. Internship projects will be technical and give you exposure to DPG's product portfolio and business processes. In this role you will work on challenging technical and business projects that help drive critical business and organizational goals Learn about Intel's Data Centric products and business Build a robust technical and business acumen Attend intern exclusive events that provide countless professional development and networking opportunities Receive coaching and mentoring from our internal network of professionals The Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits Effectively balance technical skills with relationship-building capabilities Drive for results, a passion to win, the desire to collaborate and ability to build strong, influential relationships Communication skills (oral and written) Qualifications You must possess minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Minimum Requirements The candidate must be pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. 6+ months experience in the following areas: Programming (VHDL, Verilog, C/C++, Perl, Python, TCL, Linux or Bash) Digital Logic, digital circuit design, Makefile and networking domains, kernel OS subsystems, communication protocols: TCP,IPv4/6,IPSec,Ethernet, kernel drivers, artificial, deep, and machine learning, source-code management such as Git, Linux/Windows OS, RTL, SoC, Pre-silicon verification of CPUs or verification methodologies such as OVM/UVM. This position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or PhD degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience. This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience. Preferred Requirements Previous internship experience Inside this Business Group The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world. Other Locations US,AZ,Phoenix;US,CA,Santa Clara;US,AZ,Virtual Covid Statement Intel strongly encourages employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Intel aligns to federal, state, and local laws and as a contractor to the U.S. Government is subject to government mandates that may be issued. jobTitle: Deal Flow Manager - Intel Ignite Boston
jobDescription: Job Description Intel Ignite is a 12-week program operating both in Israel and Germany for diverse and impressive seed-stage startups. The program was established as a strategic startup acceleration program reporting directly to Intel's CTO, with the following targets: Drive open innovation Connect Intel with top disruptors Identify and generate strategic technical insights for Intel Change Intel's perception by top startup innovators Act as a change agent in Intel's culture shift journey - Bring along Intel talent as we work with startups The program boasts a rigorous selection process - 4% acceptance rate. The participating startups receive hands-on mentorship from Intel and industry experts in all relevant domains, including product, technology, business, management, HR, finance, etc. In the past few months, Intel Ignite was awarded the #1 startup acceleration program in Israel by the leading tech blog Geektime. In addition, Ignite received Intel's coveted Intel Achievement Award IAA for 2021. In this role, your daily agenda will be exciting. On a regular basis, it will include but not limited to: Owning and managing the startup selection process Scouting for new innovative seed stage startups with deep technology Screening startup applications based on their technology, business model, market potential, competitive landscape team and more. Conducting due diligence of the startups in both technology and business assessments Preparing materials and startup summaries for the selection committee review Researching new markets and technologies and defining market/business rationale for explorations into new markets Attending conferences, demo days and pitch nights to expand program relationship networks and discover new startups Maintaining and creating relationships with key players in the startup ecosystem including but not limited to startups, investors, accelerators, research centers, universities, and government interests The program will be in the heart of startup ecosystem in Kendall Square, Cambridge, MA.; therefore, the Deal Flow Manager will be expected to work on site most of the week. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's in Business, Management or Computer Science/Engineering or Math 5+ years of experience in a technical position at a start-up or in a tech company 2+ years of experience in a similar Deal Flow\Associate position at a VC or in a corporate development company Preferred Qualifications An MBA or a post graduate degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or Math CTO and Co-Founder of a startup Startup funding raising or formation experience Experience in startup assessment Worked with a big multinational company in a development role Inside this Business Group Enable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software. Job Description Do you have a strong passion for optimizing cutting-edge deep learning, HPC, datacenter, and client SW for maximum performance on the latest HW? We are looking for individuals who are interested in building the world's leading deep learning compiler for current and future Intel datacenter/client CPUs and GPUs. This is a product development position with the end goal being high-quality, high-performance, secure product SW that makes the latest cutting-edge HW shine. You will start optimization pre-silicon and have access to HW shortly after it is first powered on. Product innovation and publication is encouraged and there are some opportunities to collaborate with research partners to develop ideas and translate them into the product. The Artificial Intelligent and Analytics (AIA) division is at the leading edge of the AI revolution at Intel, covering the full stack from applied ML to ML / DL and data analytics frameworks, to Intel oneAPI AI libraries, and CPU/GPU HW/SW co-design for AI acceleration. It is an organization with a strong technical atmosphere, innovation, friendly team-work spirit, and engineers with diverse backgrounds. The Deep Learning Frameworks and Libraries (DLFL) department is responsible for optimizing leading DL frameworks on Intel platforms. We also develop the popular oneAPI Deep Neural Network Library (oneDNN), and oneDNN Graph library. Our goal is to lead in Deep Learning performance for both the CPU and GPU. We work closely with other Intel business units and industrial partners. Collaborate with Frameworks and Math library teams to develop compiler optimizations for Deep Learning domain. Collaborate with open-source projects, upstream changes, coordinate internally and externally with cross geographical teams. An ideal candidate would exhibit behavioral traits that indicate Ability to work in a dynamic and team-oriented environment Ability to work closely with teammates at multiple US sites as well as with closely related teams in other countries working virtually together on the same product Positive can-do attitude, desire to deliver results and winning products Excellent written and oral communication skills You should have a passion for optimization and performance at the low level, close the HW, as well as for good SW engineering practice and usability. Job Description About Logic Technology Development Logic Technology Development - LTD delivers programs and modules to ramp new process nodes, supports HVM and provides a predictable technology cadence for Intel customers. About The Role Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a vision to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. To do this it requires focused enthusiastic leaders. Join LTD and help create the next generation of technologies that will touch the lives of people the world over for decades to come. The Design Technology Architect within the Logic Technology Division of Technology Manufacturing Group is chartered to conduct Design Technology Co-Optimization - DTCO and System Technology Co-Optimization - STCO by leveraging domain experts across various areas of Technology Development, IP development, EDA tools and Product design internal to Intel and from external ecosystem to help LTD make the appropriate technical trade-offs and decisions, especially during the definition phase of the technology life-cycle, to ensure that what Intel builds and launches is competitive against the leading foundry offerings in a similar timeframe, for the appropriate market segments of interest. In this role, you will be working with the world leading technology experts on advanced technology pathfinding and definition. You will help shape the future of Intel and semiconductor industry as a whole. The Key Focus Is As Follows The Design Technology Architect plays a key role by bringing together a diverse set of domain experts to drive DTCO, STCO, competitive analysis and technology targeting to ensure that we are in a competitive position with respect to our offerings in a similar timeframe, for the same market segment of interest. Lead n+1 and n+2 technology platform DTCOs and STCOs with internal and external customers and partners. Lead cross functional team of experts to drive technical and business analysis of what Best in class technology architecture looks like. Lead technical decision frameworks to drive clear decision making by senior technical experts and executive management. Frame the project objectives, focuses and navigates effort to solve problems, removes roadblocks, manages risks, costs, schedules, drives recommendations to align senior management. Responsibilities/Duties Drives a team of broad domain experts that covers diverse technical areas such as devices, process integration, lithography, libraries, SRAM bit cells, memory compilers, analog components and EDA / APR so that they can actively participate in DTCO and STCO covering both breadth and depth. Works collaboratively with Competitive Analysis team to set the framework for what, how and why competition is making certain technical choices to inform our own decision making parameters. Drives early, regular and systematic analysis of technology platform requirements to ensure product, process and IP mix leads to competitive offerings. This is done by collaborating with cross functional experts across product, IP and process technology teams. Jointly with the Technology Platform Targeting Team, work towards setting a best in class targets for n+1 and n+2 technologies. Drives DTCO and STCO frameworks ranging from setting platform targets, PPA validation methodology, competitive analysis, external partner selection, platform definition criteria, and others. Ensure the technical and management team is able to focus on the decision at hand by facilitating the right decision frame and the requisite data. Demonstrated results and accountability for broad leadership, building of followership and role modeling of Intel's cultural attributes of: Customer obsessed - seek to understand what matters most to our customers, listening more and talking less. One Intel - WE before ME. We work across boundaries, collaborating across the aisle and around the world. Fearless - We are bold. We take risks and challenge ourselves. We fail fast, iterate and continuously improve. Truth and Transparency - allows the best ideas to emerge and speeds our ability to solve problems faster. Inclusion - Inclusion runs through each attribute and is integral to our culture evolution. Quality - Ensure a safe workplace and demonstrate discipline to deliver the products and services that our customers and partners can always rely on. Job Description As part of the verification team supporting the Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) Search IP development, you will work closely with the Design, Architecture, and Software teams to review specification and micro-architecture, extract functional features and define verification plan including the coverage model. Your responsibilities as a Design Verification Engineer will include, but not limited to: Execute through UVM testbench development, direct and constrained random test generation at the unit level and system level. Run RTL simulation and FPGA system hardware to assist the Design and Software Teams in failures analysis and resolutions and coverage analysis and closure. Support scripted automation flow to enhance the verification methodology. The Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Behavioral Trait Solid problem-solving skill set. Qualifications Education Requirement Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or Civil Engineering plus 5 years of related field experience, or Master of Science in Electrical Engineering or Master of Science in Civil Engineering plus 5 years of related field experience preferred. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience in: UVM verification methodology. ASIC/FPGA design and verification flows including RTL design, simulation and testbench development. Experience in constrained random testing, coverage space definition and coverage model creation. Coding in System Verilog. Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. Job Description Intel's PSG (Programmable Solutions Group) is looking for a motivated senior level DFT / DFx Design Engineer to join an industry leading IC design team. About The Group Job Description Intel is undergoing a significant business transformation on a massive scale, making it among the biggest, most highly-watched business reinventions ever. Our customers and partners trust that we bring the highest level of engineering and manufacturing excellence, invention, insight, and service and continue to be on the leading edge of technological breakthroughs that create new capabilities and categories, transform industries, and improve lives. To this end, Intel Corporate Strategy Office is building a new corporate function - the Engineering Strategy and Intelligence team with a charter to develop and maintain world-class Engineering Strategy and operational Intelligence. Its mission is to Inform and guide Intel's executive staffs on best-in-class Engineering practices and trends, and recommend actionable operational targets to drive the Intel engineering machines, so that our innovation, insight, ingenuity, and resources can be harnessed to address the world's biggest challenges. About The Role In the role of Director of Strategy, Semiconductor Engineering we are looking for an experienced engineering design leader to head the semiconductor internal engineering consulting desk. This position requires an expert in silicon design engineering, who has successfully built engineering organizations and methodologies, leading semiconductor products from definition, simulation, incubation to high volume manufacturing to launch and sustain. The Director of Strategy, Semiconductor Engineering will be excited to transition from a role building hardware products into a position that can set the bar and drive best in class execution and methods for an evolving semi-conductor industry and growth in Chiplets across the entire engineering machine and product development lifecycle. This leader is expected to have high cross-team coordination capabilities, be an excellent listener, eloquent communicator and implement systems and process to create economies of scale In This Role, You Will Lead Corporate and division level strategic discussions across product lines and engineering groups to formulate and implement strategies that will accelerate Intel's engineering excellence Produce primary, often novel research and analysis work products, and benchmark engineering practices, methodologies, and capabilities. Partner with the executive management to clearly articulate Intel's engineering strategies to internal and external audiences including Intel's board of directors Indirectly influence and peer-manage a diverse set of technical and business leaders as project teams navigate ambiguous and often contentious unknowns with large potential impact on the corporate direction. Participate in industry forums and technical committees, synthesize secondary data looking for trends and insights, identify and close gaps in the collective knowledge base Identify key engineering and operational challenges, develop insights, strategies, methodologies, and systems to resolve Qualifications Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent with strong technical background. 18+ year of overall semiconductor industry experience. 5+ years in Silicon Engineering Management or Architecture. Inside this Business Group Corporate Strategy Office is chartered to support the executive office in driving corporate initiatives, including near and long-term strategy, major cross-group decision making and ensuring cross-company alignment. To deliver to that mission, the team owns shaping, driving and synthesizing insights to directionally orient trends as well as long range strategic planning/visioning , cross company alignment and greenfield innovation. Communications are essential to drive alignment so there is a focus on communications, community and acumen development. The team is ccommitted to ensuring that Intel efforts are aligned to, and actively driving success toward the most impactful business strategies.
