Job Description Join a team of researchers at the Intel Software, System and Architecture Research of Intel Labs at Hillsboro, Oregon, responsible for research on future wireless and network technologies. An important part of this research involves innovation in optical and wireless communication, implementing them on simulation and prototyping platforms, conducting experiments, and collecting and analyzing the data to support the research and development. This is an Intel Contract Employee (ICE) position and relocation assistance will not be provided. This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. The candidate will work on W-2 contract that lasts 14 months and may be extended as needed. As a DSP Research Scientist/Engineer, You Will Contribute to developing system models, leveraging state of art optical and wireless communication technologies, and formulating creative solutions. Also, the ideal candidate must have excellent communication skills and demonstrated capability to collaborate as well as work independently to deliver quality designs. Design and simulate DSP algorithms for High-speed Coherent Optical DSP architectures. Research and develop DSP algorithm specifications and create novel ideas to meet system requirements. Run simulations to predict system performance metrics and validate with designers. Explore and contribute towards challenging system modeling efforts in a cross-team setting. Work closely with Digital architecture designers to translate models to hardware design. Collaborate with stakeholders to prototype and validate design towards optimal power and performance tradeoff in different stages of product development. Great communication skills and demonstrated capability ability to collaborate as well as work independently to deliver quality designs. Qualifications Education Requirement Bachelors, Masters, OR PHD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field with 4+ years of relevant experience AND 3+ years of experience in Optical Communication DSP product design is necessary to be considered for this role. Minimum Qualifications 2+ years with Communication System modeling and Digital Signal Processing algorithms development. 3+ years of experience with High-speed Optical DSP design, especially Equalizers, Phase Recovery schemes, Clock and Data Recovery and Forward Error Correction (FEC such as BCH, LDPC, RS). 2+ years of experience in Coherent DSP Algorithms and Architecture design preferred. Proficient in Matlab OR C/C++ OR Python. Additional Preferred Qualifications Fixed point design experience is a plus. AI / ML exposure is a plus. Experience with algorithm performance vs. complexity and ASIC power tradeoffs is a plus. Identifies as a Team-player and is willing to contribute to a wide variety of projects. Experience with Optical Transport Network and Satellite communication standard is preferable. Benefits Statement Here at Intel, we invest in our people. Beyond health, dental, and retirement benefits, Intel’s benefits package includes 14 paid holidays per calendar year, three weeks of paid vacation, four-week paid sabbatical every four years of employment, family planning care including adoption and fertility assistance, and over 45 diverse employee resource groups for networking and advocacy. Intel also offers employees five bonuses per year dependent on overall company and personal performance, and an employee stock purchase program. Inside this Business Group Intel Labs is the company's world-class, industry leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units. Job Description As an EDA Tools Software Engineer in the Lead Vehicle (Test Chip) Development group, you will be responsible for the development of physical design automation tools, flows, methodologies, and processes to support design of Intel's next generation process technology and yield test chips. Your Responsibilities Will Include, But Not Limited To Development of EDA software tools and flows that automate generation of E-Test structure devices, routing, layout dummification, and physical design verification Development of Design Rule Check (DRC) run-set software to implement test structure process design rules Development and support of test chip layout library for the latest process nodes Collaborating with semiconductor process technologists to define test structure designs Troubleshoot design and DRC verification issues with complex physical design flows and tools About The Team And Organization Intel's Lead Vehicle Development (LVD) Team is one component of the larger Design Enablement (DE) organization, that provides design and manufacturing services to a variety of internal and external customers who leverage Intel's holistic design and manufacturing expertise to deliver unique circuits and systems at the leading edge of the technology curve. LVD's mission is to develop test-chips and other hardware prototypes that enable our customers to use Intel's most advanced process technologies to develop innovative products and reduce their time-to-market. Inside this Business Group As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art -- from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Job Description Become a member of one of the largest engineering companies in the world. As an Electronic Design Automation (EDA) Software Engineer in the Programmable Solution Group (PSG) you will be working on one of the most fascinating technology used in big data centers - The Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGA). You will research, design, develop, and optimize software tools that enable the use of FPGAs. Our engineers develop and optimize compilers, flows, assemblers, models, tools, and runtimes that are closely coupled to FPGA silicon, IP and boards. They will be learning about FPGAs and hardware logic design in their day to day job activities and utilize their software skillset to design, develop and optimize software abstractions and frameworks for acceleration with the FPGA. They will have many opportunities to respond to customer/client requests or events as they occur. In this role you will be developing the software for Intel® Quartus® tool that programs the next generation of FPGA devices. Your scope of responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Developing high quality C or C++ software code for enabling high-speed transceivers and other peripheral components in FPGAs. Owning, developing and enhancing tools that automate the Device Modeling of peripheral components of FPGA. Owning the hardware/software co-design architecture of various blocks. Designing and implementing new features based on the hardware/software co-design architecture as well enhancing existing features while maneuvering your way through a huge code base. Owning various analytical/logical/CAD tasks involved in device and power modeling of various peripheral components. The Ideal Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits Highly motivated individual willing to work under pressure and deliver high quality results on time. Problem-solving and analytical skills. Effective prioritization and time management skills. Stakeholder management, strong collaboration, tolerance for ambiguity and critical thinking. Excellent teamwork ethics. Willing to work in an agile work environment with a fast-paced task flow. Good interpersonal skills. Qualifications You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Minimum Qualifications Candidate must have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related field. 3+ years of experience as Bachelor's or 1+ years as Master's of experience of software development in one or more software programming/scripting languages (C/C++, Python, etc.). Experience With Preferred qualifications Data-structures/algorithms Build process/make files Version control systems like Perforce, CVS, or Git RTL using Verilog/VHDL/System Verilog FPGA architecture and tools Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. Job Description Do you love to solve technical challenges that no one has solved yet? Do you enjoy working with cross functional teams to deliver IP/SoC solutions for products that impact customers lives? If so, come join us to do something wonderful. Job Description The Accelerated Computing Systems and Graphics Group (AXG) is a newly formed team focused on execution in strategic growth areas of high-performance computing and graphics for Intel. The group is chartered with delivering solutions for integrated and discrete graphics segments across client, enterprise, and datacenter, as well as high-performance computing (HPC). In this position, the candidate would help define the architecture for next generation SoC fabrics used within Intel's advanced computing and graphics products. The candidate is expected to actively collaborate with other architects as well as design and software engineers working on complex discrete graphics SoCs. Candidate Responsibilities Include The Following Work with a global team of architects and software engineers to successfully deliver an SoC fabric architecture. Responsible for helping to define fabric-as-IP that can be delivered into multiple products across multiple generations. Interface with other teams for design collateral requirements, Close collaboration with planning teams, architects, verification, DFT, software, physical design and post-silicon teams. Drive resolution of issues with IP and SoC development teams to meet schedule and quality. The Candidate Should Exhibit Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Good understanding of SoC and IP architectures, cache coherence protocols, high performance network-on-chip design, IP integration, DV and constraints. Proactive drive to achieve high-quality results through strong team-work. Proven ability to drive solutions to complex cross-functional technical problems working with senior technical peers/partner organizations. Solid breadth of design expertise spanning all phases of the design cycle. Flexibility to work in a dynamic environment and seamlessly multitask. Qualifications BSEE/MSEE in Electrical/Computer Engineering or equivalent with a minimum of 13 years of relevant industrial experience. Inside this Business Group The focus of Accelerated Computing Systems and Graphics (AXG) is to accelerate our execution in strategic growth areas of high-performance computing and graphics. AXG is chartered with delivering high performance computing and graphics solutions (IP, Software, Systems), for both integrated and discrete segments across client, enterprise and data center. Our mission is to make zeta-scale computing accessible to every human on the planet by the end of this decade and to entertain, educate and connect billions of people with buttery smooth visual experiences. Job Description Join Intel-and build a better tomorrow. Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a vision to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. So join us-and help us create the next generation of technologies that will shape the future for decades to come. Corporate Services (CS) touches the lives of every Intel employee every day. CS creates an environment where employees can prosper while creating the innovative technologies that make amazing possible. Our scope is vast and includes operating and maintaining all Intel sites, offices, labs and factories globally as well as onsite services and experiences that help employees stay safe and productive. CS also helps to make Intel and our community a greener place by supporting Intel's commitment to environmental sustainability, including investing in conservation projects, setting company-wide environmental targets and driving reductions in greenhouse emissions, energy use, water use and waste generation. In addition, CS approaches Diversity and Inclusion with the same rigor, accountability and visibility as our critical business strategies, embedding diversity and inclusion practices in everything we do. We are responsible for building an environment where all employees feel empowered to achieve their full potential. We are a global workforce that generates diversity of thought and innovation, resulting in better overall business results. Corporate Services values and embraces individual uniqueness and empowers employees to bring their whole selves to deliver their very best. We thoughtfully embed inclusivity and diversity as core strengths in our hiring, career development and training practices. Corporate Services' success depends on our people and we highly value our amazing employees. Make Corporate Services your workplace of choice today. As a Facilities Electrical Engineer your responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Provide Facilities engineering leadership to the Virtual Factory Network for process technology transfers in support of Safety, Reliability, Quality, Environmental and Cost objectives. Own safety within area of influence. Ensure systems operate reliably to avoid manufacturing/facility or environmental excursions, own system documentation and maintenance strategy. Support Facilities technology and development for the virtual factory network. Provide direct support and maintain periodic communication with key suppliers to ensure latest and most cost effective solutions are included and technical accuracy is maintained in master specifications and standards. Provide technical guidance to ensure compliance with safety, code, and Intel standards as well as study opportunities to reduce cost and improve schedule. Provide transfer Support to FSM facilities converting to new process technologies; ongoing technical guidance to FSM sustaining facility teams to maintain and improve factory operations. The Successful Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits Skills to communicate tactical concepts across a wide range of employees; engineering peers to operational technicians to management. jobTitle: Forward Error Correction (FEC) SoC Design Engineer
jobDescription: Job Description Oversees definition, design, verification, and documentation of state-of-the-art Forward Error Correction (FEC) and Ethernet physical layer IP for next generation FPGA families. Analyzes complex FEC algorithms and develops parameterizable and efficient IP implementations, for both ASIC and FPGA. Defines and develops future FEC cores. Determines microarchitecture design, logic design, RTL coding, and system simulation. Performs all aspects of the design flow from high level design to synthesis. Oversees physical design place and route, and timing and power model generation. Participates in planning and execution of design verification and silicon validation. If you have strong Reed-Solomon background, and a passion for cutting-edge FEC development, the Intel Programmable Solutions Group would love to speak with you. Qualifications Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related field. M.Sc.; Ph.D. in relevant subject area strongly preferred. Minimum Qualifications 3+ years of experience with: High-speed forward error correction (FEC) blocks, especially Reed-Solomon codecs; the ideal candidate will also have a strong theoretical background in this area. 1+ years of experience with the following: Hardware design experience in RTL, preferably on large, complex designs. Digital design flows including RTL simulation, timing constraints. Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with ASIC design flows (libraries, EDA tools, verification methods, etc.). Broad FEC background (Viterbi, LPDC, etc.). Working understanding of IEEE Ethernet standards. Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and/or schoolwork/classes/research. Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. jobTitle: FPGA Academic Partnership Product Marketing Engineer
jobDescription: Job Description Do you have the passion to drive and help merge the custom logic design and academic worlds together with FPGAs? Come join Intel Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) as we work with universities worldwide to foster partnerships as a FPGA Academic Partnership Product Marketing Engineer . As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible, collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. As a FPGA Academic Partnership Product Marketing Engineer, you will : Define and share technical collateral that demonstrate solution messaging, positioning, and value propositions for PSG's FPGA Software being used in academic classrooms. Work closely with planning, applications, engineering, sales, and business markets to determine key FPGA curricula. Focus on the software user persona to showcase how Intel Quartus Prime software can be used to learn about FPGAs and associated design methodologies. Own the vision for FPGA based academic programs and gives feedback and improvement suggestions based on user experiences. Develop, refine, and implement strategies and works closely with Intel Labs and universities around the world to build a continuous pipeline of diverse talent with strong Intel FPGA knowledge. The Ideal Candidate Will Also Create and implement innovative strategies for a scalable university program. Advocate for academia related programs and work closely with the emerging professional and internship programs to promote Intel's culture and opportunities for college graduates. Work across organizational boundaries in a highly collaborative environment and represent the academic program internally with stakeholders and externally with universities, professors, and partners. Identify and cultivate partnerships with universities around the world to develop pathways that lead to curricula using Intel FPGAs. Discover potential students or groups or programs that Intel can help mentor and/or advise technically (e.g. capstone projects). Maintain, update, and expand the tools and methodology collateral used in the program. Represent Intel PSG at universities and academia conferences and events. Evangelize the value proposition that Intel FPGAs bring to the academic community. Develop technical papers, presentations, videos, and other collateral to demonstrate Intel's leadership in FPGAs and value to academia. Engage with technical experts and translate technical details to user messages at conferences. Qualifications Relevant experience can be obtained through work, classes, projects, internships, and/or military experience. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Education Requirement Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field What You’ll Bring (Minimum Qualifications) 7+ years of total experience, experience should include: FPGA, Embedded/Digital Logic, Applications or related VHDL, Verilog, SystemVerilog EDA Tools Preferred Qualifications Ways to Stand Out From the Crowd (Experience in one, or more, of the following preferred qualifications is considered a plus factor) Writing and delivering outbound marketing content AI/ML OpenVINO™ oneAPI or other high level design tools High Performance Compute (HPC) Embedded Processor Experience Academic Research Inside this Business Group The Data Center & Artificial Intelligence Group (DCAI) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world. Job Description Become a member of one of the largest engineering companies in the world! Intel is on a mission to create and extend programmable technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on earth. To make this ambitious mission happen, we need the right people who will share their passion for our vision. Intel is seeking highly qualified candidates to join our Intel Federal (IFED) group within our larger Programmable Solution Group as a FPGA Design Application Engineer! Intel Programmable Solutions Group, (PSG), is seeking committed, customer-focused, and motivated candidates to work with public sector customers on new processes and products to drive innovation and leading-edge FPGA projects. As a Hardware Design Engineer/Applications Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting customers and enabling the successful completion of customer projects by providing technical expertise, guidance, design optimizations, and issue resolution. Our Hardware/Applications Engineers are engaged during all phases of the product development cycle including feature definition, project setup, project execution, and primarily technical support. You will provide technical training, consultation, and hands-on assistance to developers in specialty areas of the FPGA during the product design cycle. In addition, they create example designs and work with Intel engineering resources to validate and debug current IP products. Your role will include, but is not limited to, the following: Provide technical support, fully resolve customer issues and queries from the Intel office or when appropriate on-site at the customer facility. Analyze customer designs, and provide solutions for Intel's intellectual property, IP cores, and I/O technologies targeting leading-edge Field Programmable Gate Array FPGA technologies, efficiently implement these optimizations on FPGAs. Create designs for customers, analyze customer designs, identify bottlenecks, and provide optimization techniques and guidance on Timing optimizations. Provide demonstrations and proofs of concepts to highlight Intel FPGA capabilities. Participate in collateral development. Becoming a subject matter expert on using the technology and providing feedback on how to make it easy to understand and use. Developing technical assets such as user guides, application notes, design examples, demos, and training that will enable customers to successfully design with our products. You must possess the below minimum education requirements and minimum required qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Education Requirement Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field with 4 years of experience or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field with 3 years of experience. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications 4 years of FPGA design experience. 4 years FPGA design and optimization. 4 years of experience in Verilog and/or VHDL coding and debug skills including RTL code optimizations for timing closure. 3 years of experience in Verilog and/or VHDL coding and timing closure, familiar with FPGA design and optimization flow. 3 years of experience with high-speed test equipment such as scopes, BERTs, spectrum analyzers, and protocol analyzers. Preferred Qualifications 6 years of FPGA design experience Debug experience (e.g. system level, product level issues) Experience with design tools (e.g. Design Compiler, Vivado, Quartus, etc.) Embedded software engineering or system design. Hardware/board debug experience. Experience with Cadence Allegro or DxDesigner/PADS Experience with MATLAB Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. Job Description You'll be part of a team developing the next generation of FPGA design tools for Intel's Programmable Solutions Group. We are looking for an energetic, top-notch FPGA Hardware Software Architect who will be directly responsible for defining the next generation Hard Processor System, Network on Chip, Source Synchronous IO and Transceiver IP and the tools flow to easily enable solutions for customer. The ideal candidate has experience multiple FPGA development life cycles and understand the intricate handshake and co-development environment between silicon design and software tools developers. They have demonstrated they can identify architecture that are user and Software friendly. The candidate must also demonstrate clear understanding of what a good customer tool flow and possess excellent communication skills. In This Role You Will Get To Own Hardware/Software Co-Design with silicon and soft-IP architects defining requirements and specifications of complex next generation Embedded Processors, Source Synchronous IO Solutions (DDR, MIPI), SerDes Transceiver Solutions. Architect customer design flow from IP generations to various Intel® Quartus® tools integrating multiple IP into complex sub-system solutions. Architect new tools to enable earlier customer engagement with ability to evaluate system performance. Qualifications Relevant experience can be obtained through work, classes, projects, internships, and/or military experience. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Education Requirement Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. Minimum Qualifications 10+ years of relevant experience, experience should include FPGA Development. Experience with FPGA architectures and use cases. Preferred Qualifications Experience in one (or more) of the following is considered a plus factor 15+ years of FPGA development experience. Experience with FPGA development and/or FPGA Tools development. Experience with sub-system solutions - Source Synchronous and/or SerDes Protocols. Job Description Intel is a global leader, creating world-changing technology that enables progress and enriches lives. We are at the intersection of several technology inflections - artificial intelligence, 5G network transformation, and the rise of the intelligent edge- that together will shape the future of technology. Intel Federal Labs and Intel's Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) Military, Aerospace and Government (MAG) Group is searching for a talented and innovative FPGA Hardware/Firmware Engineer for collaboratively focused research, PoC design and development to advance novel and exciting solutions to government facing problems leveraging Intel's latest and high-performance tools and silicon. This role will include technical RnD in a collaborative small team environment, working closely with other team members with complementary skillsets and implementing innovative technical solutions. The FPGA Hardware/Firmware Engineer will support development of Software Defined Radio technology and will develop, test and debug FPGA RTL to be implemented in Intel FPGAs supporting various interfaces, such as DDR, EMIF, JESD, UARTs, SPI, I2C, GPIO, JESD and USB general FPGA logic and logic to interface with the HPS (embedded ARM cores). The candidate must be proficient in hand coding RTL (Verilog and/or VHDL) however high-level design tools can also be used such as HLS, Intel IP development tools and Platform Designer for targeting Intel FPGAs. As a member of a small, highly technical team the candidate will be working on state-of-the-art radio technology to solve problems facing the US government. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Job Description Become a member of one of the largest engineering companies in the world! Intel is on a mission to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on earth. To make this ambitious mission happen, we need the right people who will share their passion for our vision. Intel is seeking highly qualified candidates to join our Intel Federal (IFED) group within our larger Programmable Solution Group as a Software Engineer! Join our Quartus and eTools development team as a Software Engineer where you will research, design, develop, and optimize software tools that enable the use of Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGA). Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To Research, design, develop, and optimize software tools that enable the use of Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGA) and eASIC devices. jobTitle: Frontend Tool Flow and Methodology (TFM) Lead
jobDescription: Job Description The Programmable Solutions Group at Intel is seeking a seasoned Frontend Tool Flow and Methodology (TFM) Lead to define and lead our strategies towards industry leading frontend design entry, checking and release methods. The Frontend TFM Lead is the organization's expert to spread industry best practices for RTL design to the products of the PSG supporting FPGAs. This is an excellent opportunity to join a highly inclusive and talented cross-functional team to maintain best-in-class design methodology that is extending beyond silicon development activities into end-to-end FPGA program enablement. This dynamic role will involve direct working relationships with Intel senior management and the technical community at Intel and the industry with immense opportunity for rapid learning experience and personal growth. As a principal engineer of the organization, the Frontend TFM Lead will direct and guide RTL coding practices and workflow that provide better efficiency for downstream flows (for example, design-for-test, design verification, emulation, and place-and-route physical implementation). Responsibilities include: Seek to understand the inefficiencies that design teams currently face, orchestrate solutions, and align the organization to these solutions; Work cross functionally with the Software organization and other groups to support a development ecosystem for Intel's FPGA customers. The ideal candidate for this role has demonstrated a track record for driving project technology readiness or pathfinding phase, leading to predictable execution of actual product development without compromising quality. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Job Description Come build a future with us! Intel is seeking highly qualified candidates to join our System Solutions Engineering (SSE) team, part of the Programmable Solutions Group (PSG). PSG continues to deliver industry-leading (FPGA) Field-Programmable Gate Array , solutions to customers and our team is responsible for the technical enablement of customer applications in embedded and defense segments. We aim to be domain experts while bringing together applicational needs and the future of FPGA technology. Do you love a technical challenge? Are you a problem solver that loves team collaboration and helping customers? Are you a visionary that challenges the status quo? Intel Federal Labs and Intel's SSE team is searching for talented and innovative SoC Design Engineers to participate in collaboratively focused research, design, and development to advance novel and exciting solutions to government facing problems leveraging Intel's latest and high-performance tools. As a Full Chip Engineer, you will be developing timing and power methodologies and executing full-chip timing for Intel's Programmable Solutions Group's next generation product lines in the world's most advanced process technologies. This will be a fast-paced dynamic environment where you will be part of a high-performance design team working toward next generation FPGA products. You will work in a hands-on capacity performing full chip timing and power analysis. You will utilize your extensive design experience and interpersonal skills to efficiently solve technical issues, drive continuous improvement, negotiate, and clearly communicate technical trade-offs with a diverse cross-functional and multi-site team. Experienced to work to aggressive schedules as part of a team and independently. Your Role Will Include, But Not Limited To Design and Architecture understanding. Interaction with Front End and Back End teams, clocking and constraints development. Understanding extraction issues, design margins, timing signoff and quality checks. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define system level power optimization solutions, provide power targets to design teams, and commit product power to meet business goals Be part of debug and troubleshooting for a wide variety of tasks up to and including difficult, critical design issues and proactive intervention You must possess the below minimum education requirements and minimum required qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field plus 9 or more years of industry work experience, or Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 6+ years of work experience Minimum Required Qualifications 8+ years of relevant experience should include: Experience in SoC development Experience with advanced process nodes (e.g. 32nm and below). Industry standard timing formats such as Liberty, Verilog, and Design Constraints (SDC). Static Timing Analysis (STA) / Correlating STA results with Spice. Timing modeling and library QA. Power analysis tools such as Primetime-PX, Redhawk, Power Artist and Spice Script writing for design automation in one or more of the following languages (Python, Perl, or TCL). Silicon modeling concepts (e.g. AOCV, POCV). Additional Preferred Qualifications 10+ years of SoC Development / Timing Lead Experience Experience in the completion of several complex multi voltage domain Experience in power model generation and low power strategy Experience with common modes of operation, including functional and DFT, for use in constraint review and management. Job Description Intel Corporation is the world’s leading technology company that develops, designs, manufactures, and markets semiconductor processors that empowers digitization and enriches lives. We operate in over 60 countries with manufacturing and distribution activities in the Americas, EMEA and Greater Asia. The Global Tax Department is seeking a Global Tax Planning Director to join its Tax Planning team playing an integral role in leading global supply chain tax planning and structuring as Intel launches new products and business initiatives including expansion of manufacturing operations in the U.S., Europe and Asia. The ideal candidate will have deep subject matter expertise in outbound U.S. International tax law, with supply chain experience, and lead a team of tax experts based in India, Malaysia, and Vietnam. The candidate should be experienced in managing a tax team with strong communication skills to collaborate with functional business leaders and support government incentive negotiations. This is a high visibility leadership position, and it is based in Santa Clara, California with remote work arrangement available for candidates based within Pacific and Central time zones. The position reports to the Vice President Finance – Global Tax Planning & Controversy. Job Responsibilities Design and implement strategic global tax efficient manufacturing supply chain structures for new products and SAAS initiatives in EMEA and Greater Asia. Design and plan for integration of acquired companies with existing supply chain and operating flows collaborating with M&A, transfer pricing and indirect tax teams. Collaborate and advise Business Unit leadership on launch of new business initiatives, their tax efficient structure and resulting global tax impact. Support manufacturing site expansion tax incentives and government negotiations. Collaborate with Tax Operations team on tax provision matters associated with acquisition, divestiture and global tax planning. Analyze tax impacts and advise Tax Operations team on tax reporting matters resulting from U.S. and international tax legislative and regulatory developments. Collaborate with Transfer Pricing team to advise strategies on intercompany transactions for operations in Greater Asia region. Oversee local country tax reporting and controversy matters in India, Malaysia, Vietnam, Korea, and Australia. Qualifications MST, J.D. or LLM with 13+ years of experience in the tax function at a multinational corporation, or public accounting/law firms. Strong quantitative skills and deep technical knowledge of US international taxation provisions (e.g., subpart F, GILTI, FTC, FDII, BEAT). Excellent research skills, including effective writing and verbal communication skills. Ability to work independently and effectively with cross functional non-tax teams and meet targeted deadlines for project completion. Inside this Business Group As members of the Finance team, employees act as full partners in making and supporting business decisions that are aimed at maximizing shareholder value. Intel Finance has a strong focus on facilitating change and improvement both within finance and in the operations supported. Job Description The Graphics Performance Analyzers (GPA) team within the Software and Advanced Technology Group (SATG) is hiring a graphics software engineer who can deliver core components as a technical contributor and demonstrate an ability to work as a part of the highly skilled and collaborative multi-geo project team. The GPA team is supporting and extending a high-profile tool suite for optimizing graphics workloads used in the gaming industry, focusing on Intel's latest graphics silicon. This position is ideal for a motivated and talented individual with a keen interest in performance profiling and 3D graphics in the gaming industry, and who is willing to grow a market-leading tool suite beyond the current feature set. We are actively looking for an experienced software developer with skills rooted in C++. The ideal candidate is an energetic software developer with experience in Graphics and Gaming toolsets. The candidate will work to design, develop, maintain, and validate core software components on a variety of Intel-powered devices and operating systems. An Ideal Candidate Would Exhibit Behavioral Traits That Indicate Strong oral and written communication skills and clarity in technical communications Strong attention to detail when designing and writing code, running tests, and filing defects Self-starter with the ability to work independently Qualifications Qualifications Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork/ classes/ research and/or relevant previous job and/ or internship experiences. Minimum Qualifications Bachelors with 2+ years or Master’s with 1+ years in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical/Software Engineering or related discipline 3+ years of C++ experience with exposure to writing Cross-Platform Code 2+ years of experience with the following technical skills: Good knowledge in the areas of 3D graphics techniques and the 3D graphics pipeline Good understanding of at least one of 3D graphics APIs such as Vulkan, DirectX, OpenGL, or Metal. This position is not eligible for an Intel immigration sponsorship. Preferred Qualifications Experience developing apps with at least one Graphics API preferably Vulkan or DirectX 12 Experience Developing 3D games / Games industry experience Ability to contribute to the complex technical projects Experience shipping production software in an Agile/Scrum Team Multi-geo and cross-cultural communication experience Inside this Business Group Do you want to impact how thousands of software developers around the world use Intel platforms? Join the Developer Software Engineering (DSE) organization and work on the latest technology enabling compilers, debuggers, analyzers, libraries, and parallel runtimes. You will develop industry-leading software which abstracts and showcases Intel platforms, extracts peak performance, and amplifies Intel business through our Hardware and Software developer communities. jobTitle: Graduate Intern, NAND Product Development Engineer(SK)
jobDescription: Job Description This is an exciting time to be at Intel! Come join Intel's NAND Design Technology and Manufacturing (NAND-DTM) Group as a Product Development Engineer and work on one of the most advanced 3DNAND and SSD technology portfolios in the world. As a global leader in the semiconductor industry, Intel possesses many industry leading System Software Division (SSD ) technologies including the most capable Quadruple Level Cell QLC NAND Flash products. Come join a dynamic and ever challenging team focused on the development and delivery of innovative and exciting storage solutions. This position is in the NAND-DTM Group which is aligned to phase 2 of the sale of the NAND business to Solidigm, a wholly owned subsidiary of SK hynix. Employees in this business group will work on developing NAND technology and components. Phase 2 of the transaction is expected to close in March 2025 at which time employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition employment to Solidigm. Solidigm, a leading global supplier of NAND flash memory solutions, is headquartered in San Jose, California with offices worldwide. Responsibilities may be quite diverse of a technical nature. Experience and education requirements will vary significantly depending on the unique needs of the job. Responsibilities May Include, But Are Not Limited To You will creatively apply the technical know-how (engineering fundamentals, scientific knowledge, systems thinking, analytical thinking, prototyping, and testing knowledge) against design constraints and boundary conditions (industrial design, cost, performance criteria and other design constraints) to research, develop and produce solutions. The Ideal Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits Self-motivated individual willing to take and follow directions and deliver to schedule. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills, problem/conflict resolution skills. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Minimum Qualifications Candidate must be pursuing a Master's or PhD in Electrical/Electronics/Computer Engineering, Computer Science or other related engineering program. 6+ months of experience or equivalent coursework in the following areas: Programming in one or more languages like C, C++, Perl, Python or SQL etc. Preferred Qualifications Angular, JavaScript, and ReST API's. Source control management tools such as GIT and debugging issues via IDE or web browser. Inside this Business Group Employees in Intel's NAND Product Group deliver solutions that are transforming computing across all segments from data centers to Ultrabooks. They invent, develop, bring to market and support customers with leading-edge NAND flash memory and system level solutions such as solid state drives (SSDs). SSDs are accelerating performance for gaming enthusiasts, reducing total cost of ownership for IT managers of data centers and improving security and reliability for businesses. This dynamic group is strategically positioned to become the leading Non-Volatile Memory solution supplier for the compute segment and is a key to expanding markets and continuing the growth for Intel. jobTitle: Graduate Intern - Office Admin - Intel Ignite
jobDescription: Job Description Location: Intel Ignite Boston (Cambridge, MA - Kendall Square) Intel Ignite is a 12-week program operating both in Israel and Germany for diverse and impressive seed-stage startups. The program was established as a strategic startup acceleration program, it reports directly to Intel CTO, with the following targets: Drive open innovation Connect Intel with top disruptors Identify and generate strategic technical insights for Intel Change Intel's perception by top startup innovators Act as a change agent in Intel's culture shift journey - Bring along Intel talent as we work with startups The program boasts a rigorous selection process - 4 percent acceptance rate. The participating startups receive hands-on mentorship from Intel and industry experts in all relevant domains, including product, technology, business, management, HR, finance, etc. In the past few months, Intel Ignite was awarded the #1 startup acceleration program in Israel by the leading tech blog (Geektime). We are looking for a Graduate Intern to support our executive team and program. You will administer business-related tasks for the team such as scheduling meetings, organizing travel, meet-ups/events, follow-up tasks, and other organizational activities. To do this role properly you should have a detailed understanding of the full Microsoft Office suite, be extremely fast at solving problems. Responsibilities Organize and schedule meetings and appointments Maintain contact lists Produce and distribute correspondence memos, letters, and forms Submit and reconcile expense reports Provide general support to visitors Handle multiple projects Reply to email, telephone, or face to face enquiries Resolve administrative problems Book travel arrangements Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Handle sensitive information in a confidential manner Oversee office environment materials and office supplies Support meet ups, coordinate catering and other suppliers Qualifications This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. Minimum Qualifications You must be pursuing a Graduate degree in Business Management, Marketing, Operations Management or a similar field of study. Experience with scheduling and calendaring Experience organizing events Experience with MS Office 365 applications Inside this Business Group Enable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software. Job Description At Intel, Design Enablement (DE) is one of the key pillars enabling Intel to deliver winning products in the marketplace. Your work will directly enable design teams to get to market faster with leadership products on cutting edge technologies. As part of the Design Enablement/Process Design Kit (PDK) group, you will join a highly motivated team of talented engineers solving challenging technical problems enabling PDKs for Intel's most advanced process technologies and drive PDKs towards industry standard methods and ease of use for the end customers. The job requires partnering and leveraging domain experts across various areas of Design Enablement, Technology Development, and product design teams to validate and deliver high quality technology collaterals for enablement of EDA tools. As an EDA Tool Software Engineering Intern, you'll be involved in the following: Analog design and physical verification flows for Electro Migration (EM) and Electrostatic Discharge (ESD); extraction and simulation tools; scripting with Python and continuous improvement efforts to meet quality as well as emerging capability needs. This is an internship and compensation will be given accordingly based on candidate education level and internship duration. This is a full time (40 hours/week) and 3 to 6-month internship. Qualifications You must possess the below requirements to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your coursework, classes, research, relevant previous job, and/or internship experiences. Minimum Requirements Actively pursuing a MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related engineering field. 3+ months knowledge/experience in the following areas: EDA tools for Analog design, extraction, simulation, and/or validation Scripting language like Python, Skill, TCL or Perl Preferred Demonstrated decision making and problem solving. Skill with Ansys Totem, Synopsys CSRA, and/or Cadence Voltus-Fi EDA tools. Inside this Business Group As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art -- from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology Development and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore’s Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth. Job Description Intel's Accelerated Computing Systems and Graphics group (AXG) delivers Intel's 3D graphics, media, display GPU, and Parallel Computing Technology. If you are passionate about computer graphics and want to work with leading graphics researchers on Intel's latest GPU/CPU architecture, then AXG has opportunities for you. Your Responsibilities Could Involve But Not Limited To Conduct research devising new techniques in real-time 3D rendering under the guidance of an Intel graphics researcher Implement and analyze new real-time rendering algorithms or other highly parallel algorithms. Potentially impact Intel graphics hardware and software products and publication in industry or academia. We're looking for graphics explorers who are collaborative and team oriented with strong written and verbal communications skills, ready to follow ideas and findings where-ever they take you to innovate and make a difference with Intel real-time graphics. Come join us. Behavioral Traits That We Are Looking For Willing to comprehend and analyze rendering literature. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Minimum Qualifications Candidate must be a student currently pursuing Masters or PhD Degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering with an emphasis in computer graphics. Candidate should have 1 + years of work or educational experience in the following: Software development in C++ with graphics shading languages and/or GPU compute languages (e.g. OpenGL, Vulkan, DirectX12). Experience developing advanced graphics algorithms such as: raster graphics, ray traced based graphics, global illumination, depth of field, motion blur, acceleration structures, etc. Preferred Qualifications Pursuing PhD Degree Expertise in designing task, data, and pipeline parallel algorithms and systems. Experience creating real-time rendering effects using programmable shaders. Background in applying machine learning techniques to graphics with familiarity with TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc. Familiarity with serial and parallel programming environments used in real-time rendering such as; C, C++, TBB, CUDA and OpenCL. Knowledge of GPU architecture and/or GPU workloads and performance characteristics Experience using profilers and debugging tools for performance analysis. Inside this Business Group The focus of Accelerated Computing Systems and Graphics (AXG) is to accelerate our execution in strategic growth areas of high-performance computing and graphics. AXG is chartered with delivering high performance computing and graphics solutions (IP, Software, Systems), for both integrated and discrete segments across client, enterprise and data center. Our mission is to make zeta-scale computing accessible to every human on the planet by the end of this decade and to entertain, educate and connect billions of people with buttery smooth visual experiences. Job Description Job Description Do you want to innovate and create an industry-leading developer cloud as a Cloud Software Engineering Intern? The Developer Cloud Platform Group (DCP) within Intel's Software and Advanced Technology Group (SATG) is developing and shaping the way people think about computing by focusing on developers, ecosystem partners, and academia. We are redefining the space with cutting-edge cloud services which leverage our portfolio of industry-leading SW and HW. Join us as a Cloud Software Engineering Intern if you want to drive the business success of the world's most innovative developer cloud. We are looking for multiple Cloud software engineering interns. As a Cloud Software Engineering Intern: You develop Proof of Concept (POC) for the cloud software services. You write unit tests and validation automation tests for cloud software services. You develop the reference cloud platform software and improve or enable customer designs to obtain the best value from Intel products within the cloud. An ideal candidate would exhibit behavioral traits that indicate: Excellent written/verbal English communication and presentation skills You must be available for a minimum internship duration of 10-12 weeks, with a maximum of 6-12 months. During your internship you must be available to work 40 hours/week. When applying, please specify your availability and your expected month/year of graduation. This role can be performed remotely from any US-based location. Qualifications You must possess the minimum qualifications below to be initially considered for this position. The experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork/ classes/ research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Minimum Qualifications Currently, and during your entire internship period, you must be actively enrolled. Degree should be an MS or PhD in Computer Science, or Computer Engineering or Mathematics or other similar Software Engineering related discipline. Proficiency with one or more: Python, Golang, and Java scripts. Proficiency in Linux or Windows Operating system. Familiarity with one or more cloud-native computing technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, Containers, Microservices, and Red Hat OpenShift Preferred Qualifications (any one of the below would be extra credit): Machine Learning background with Tensorflow Familiarity with RestFul interfaces using flask or python. Familiarity with databases like Mongo, PostgreSQL or MariaDB. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevSecOps concepts. Familiarity with programming languages: Python, Go, Java. Knowledge of Jupyter Hub, Notebooks, Github, etc. Designing and operating distributed systems, networking design, and implementation experience. Proficiency developing modern AI and graphics workloads. Knowledge of Deep Learning frameworks (ex: TensorFlow, Pytorch) and models and is familiar with the deployment of DL-based use cases. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's OR PhD degree, OR a Bachelor’s degree with three years ’ related job experience. Job Description Post-Si Design-for-Debug tools team within AXG-XPE organization is seeking experienced candidate for the development and validation of next generation integrated and discrete graphics debug tools. Job Description At Intel, we drive innovation and break through barriers every single day. We look for remarkable people who understand partnership and have desire to disrupt the status quo. Intel's products support multiple platforms like TikTok, Instagram and Amazon. Our switches process millions of customer transactions, calls and data transmissions without interruption in seconds. Creating technology that works that fast, takes talent and passion. We invite you to come join a creative team of engineers dedicated to designing technologies that network the leading cloud-service datacenters. We offer, paid sabbatical, Immediate vesting at 100% of company matched 401k contributions, Annual and Quarterly Bonuses, Stock Programs, On-campus health clinics, fitness classes, spas, healthy meals, café options and so much more! Intel presents a vast amount of possibilities on a global scale. You can change your focus every few years within Intel if you choose or continue to grow within your initial role. We have the infrastructure to support employees and their goals. The Hard Processor System (HPS) Architect will be responsible for the processor Subsystem architecture for Intel® FPGA and will provide technical leadership for those devices. The role covers specification generation, specification negotiation, system modelling, and definition of processor core and peripherals. The HPS architect will require a broad knowledge in Processors, peripherals and IP design. The architect will provide high speed interconnects, coherency and caching schemes to eliminate performance bottlenecks. The candidate will understand clocking, configuration, boot flows and proficiency to work with Software and firmware teams. The candidate will be responsible for defining complex HPS subsystem, understand the complex global nature of the problem, work cross functionally with several other architects. Experience in FPGA, industry or application. Qualifications BS in Electrical Engineering or relevant field Experience as a Hardware Design with a minimum of 8+ years of experience in design and architecture Experience in Processor, CPU based designs, with a minimum of 5 years of experience in CPU based designs. Experience with ARM or RISCV or Intel based processors. Experience in architecting complex systems using and demonstrating success in deploying those systems. Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. Job Description Intel is a global leader, creating world-changing technology that enables progress and enriches lives. We are at the intersection of several technology inflections – artificial intelligence, 5G network transformation and the rise of the intelligent edge- together will shape the future of technology. Intel's Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) has been delivering industry leading custom logic solutions to customers since inventing the world's first programmable logic device in 1984. The mission of PSG is to drive the future for Field-Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) and Intel® eASIC™ technology/solutions around the globe. Within PSG, you'll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds/engineers in the world. The Custom Fabric Engineering (CFE) group is part of Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) is responsible for architecture and design of Intel's FPGA products. These products have wide variety uses covering industrial automation, space exploration, data centers, automotive, and internet routers to name a few. You will be part of a highly successful and visible role of building the key hardware components of the FPGA. You will be a working member of the IC design and implementation team. As a Hardware Design Engineer, you will complete the following but not limited to: Provide micro-architect and implement the next generation clocking network. Micro-architect and implement the next generation clocking network. Experience in FPGA clocking systems (Design custom FPGA clocking solutions from concept to product.) Collaborate with architecture and physical design teams to execute in our next generation process nodes. Experience in circuit parameters, process parameters, and design high yield custom circuits for manufacturing. Work independently to develop, document, execute on our next generation clocking system for our next generation FPGA programs and play a crucial role in contributing to our industry leadership targets. Provide Transistor level circuit design including standard cells. Qualifications Education Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or MS degree. Minimum Qualifications 8+ high speed clock network design. Experience with SPICE simulators for high yield custom circuit design. Experience with Verilog, design signoff tools and flows, Virtuoso, ICC/Innovus. Experience with SPICE simulators for functionality and reliability. Experience with programming languages like Python, Perl, CSH, TCL, Makefiles. Experience in transistor level circuit design including standard cells. Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. Job Description Initiates the design, development, execution and implementation of scientific research projects to fuel Intel's growth in the areas of computing, communication, technology and manufacturing and new business opportunity. Job Description The Intel Module Repair (IMR) Manufacturing Technician - Intel Contract Employee (ICE) located in Ocotillo (OC) performs functions associated with operating, maintaining, and performing maintenance on various specialized production equipment. Work is somewhat complex and is performed within the spectrum ranging from narrowly defined parameters and limited judgment up to highly complex and nonstandard assignments in nature and broadly defined parameters. Normally receives general instructions on routine work, and detailed instructions on new work. The Manufacturing Technician will be responsible for, but not limited to: Collect and evaluate operating data to conduct online equipment adjustment and ensure process optimization. Run product in a qualitative way. Preventive maintenance, troubleshooting, spares, and sustaining. Improvement processes, troubleshooting nonstandard events in the production line, and reviewing technological health and stability. Be in charge of the buddy, trainer, and certifier levels and is in charge of updating training manuals. May participate in safety forums and Emergency Response Team as required. The Ideal Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits Judgement and initiative are required in resolving complex nonstandard problems and developing recommendations. Verbal and written communication skills and be comfortable presenting issues and solutions. Understanding of the importance of quality and skills to effectively use process control and quality systems. Work in a diverse team environment and multitask. Work with minimal supervision and adjust to rapidly changing priorities. Organizational skills. Self-motivated. Analytical problem solving and testing skills. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Relevant experience can be obtained through school work, classes and project work, internships, military training, and/or work experience Minimum Qualifications The candidate must possess at least one of the following educational or experience requirements: Associate's Degree in a science, technology, math, engineering, or STEM discipline; OR Be actively enrolled in an accredited education program pursuing an Associate's or Bachelor's Degree in a science, technology, math, engineering, or STEM discipline; OR Military training in a technical field such as: electronics, mechanical, or similar technical field; and at least 6 months of hands on experience; OR 12+ months of experience in a semiconductor environment. Candidate must be willing to lift up to 35 pounds (18 kgs) 4 times a day, spend the majority of time (less than 90 percent less break time) on the floor working on tool sets, frequent standing, bending, reaching for 9 hours and some walking in between work areas. This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. Preferred Qualifications Previous experience in electronics, equipment troubleshooting, installation, repair, and operation semiconductor manufacturing technology. Experience with software macros and coding knowledge. jobTitle: Industrial and Auto Strategic/Technical Business Development Manager
jobDescription: Job Description Intel is a global leader, creating world-changing technology that enables progress and enriches lives. We are at the intersection of several technology inflections - artificial intelligence, 5G network transformation, and the rise of the intelligent edge - that together will shape the future of technology. The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) will continue to drive the future for FPGAs and Structured ASICs to build a better tomorrow. By pushing forward in cutting-edge technology, our work is at the heart of innovation. With a career at Intel, you will have the opportunity to shape the future for everyone. As an Industrial and Auto Strategic Business Development Manager , you will be responsible for, but not limited to: Performing market research and competitive analysis projects on technology megatrends, customer products that include FPGA and the relevant use models (i.e. how the FPGA is used to support the end product functionalities), power and performance benchmarking versus competing offerings to our FPGAs. Assist system architects for the end market segments on FPGA requirement gathering activities. Support driving the definition, trade-off analysis, and convergence of next-generation IP solutions enabling various FPGA end markets and applications. Support generating market/product/feature requirements based on input from customers and business partners. Network and coordinate with business stakeholders to continuously drive customer requirements into the product definitions and solutions roadmap. Maintain and communicate a detailed IP product roadmap. Coordinate with Product Planning peers to align inter-dependent programs and solutions. Manage and track input and change requests to Planning and Engineering. Qualifications Relevant experience can be obtained through work, classes, projects, internships, and/or military experience. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Education Requirement Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. What You’ll Bring (Minimum Qualifications) 10+ years of relevant experience. Experience should include some or all of the following: FPGA Design. ASIC/SoC Design. Industrial Robotics Applications. Functional Safety. Hardware Security. Preferred Qualifications Ways to Stand Out From the Crowd (Experience in one, or more, of the following preferred qualifications is considered a plus factor) FPGA design/application/technical marketing. IP Planning. System design experience using FPGA in end applications (e.g., test and measurement, ASIC Proto, Broadcast, video, medical or consumer applications). FPGA design tools (Quartus and Vivado). Direct customer and sales engagements driving successful design wins. 3rd Party Partner engagements, identification, and GTM strategies. Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. jobTitle: Intel Design Automation Engineer for E-core Microprocessor Tools & Flows
jobDescription: Job Description If advanced development of breakthrough technologies for next-generation power efficient microprocessor cores excites you, join us to do something wonderful! We are looking for exceptionally talented and passionate engineers who work together and make the future of computing possible. Join us to be a member of our central Computer Aided Design (CAD)/Design Automation (DA) team that builds and supports state-of-the-art tools, flows and methods for the latest E-Core RTL, architectures and technologies. As part of the team you will be responsible for defining, implementing and supporting the specific E-Core flows, tools and methods. This includes working with designers, validation, tool vendors and IT. We Have Positions Available For Front End tools/flows including tools for RTL Simulation, Static checks, Emulation, Gate Level simulation and test generators User environment tools and flows responsible for handling physical design collateral including database and flow control managers. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications Computer or Software engineer with a passion for scripting and coding with the ability to test any code developed to deliver with a high level of quality. Enjoys working in a team environment including working directly with design and validation engineers to ensure tools and flows meet given specifications. Educational or career experience with databases, compute systems, cloud computing and/or machine learning. Qualifications Candidate must have a degree in Software, Computer or Electrical Engineering with an educational/experience level of a: Bachelor's degree with 4+ years of relevant experience - OR – Master´s degree with 3+ years of relevant experience -OR - PhD with 1+ years of relevant experience Must Also Have The Below Attributes Excellent programming and scripting skills in C/C++, Perl/Tcl, Python, shell scripting or similar languages Solid understanding of software fundamental like data structures and algorithms Very good problem solving skills to be able to view, debug and enhance/refactor existing software Very strong communication/interpersonal skills to interface with various stakeholders including design, vendors and IT Preferred Qualifications Experience with one of the following domains either through coursework or past experience: RTL Verification (System Verilog, UVM etc.) OR Database and Flow Management for physical design systems. Familiarity with the Linux OS Inside this Business Group In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power Intel’s products. From development, to integration, validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s Law and groundbreaking innovations. DEG is Intel’s engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as well as other engineering teams. As a critical provider of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient and effective manner.
