Job Description Join a team of researchers at the Intel Software, System and Architecture Research of Intel Labs at Hillsboro, Oregon, responsible for research on future wireless and network technologies. An important part of this research involves innovation in optical and wireless communication, implementing them on simulation and prototyping platforms, conducting experiments, and collecting and analyzing the data to support the research and development. This is an Intel Contract Employee (ICE) position and relocation assistance will not be provided. This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. The candidate will work on W-2 contract that lasts 14 months and may be extended as needed. As a DSP Systems Engineer, You Will Contribute to developing system models, leveraging state of art optical and wireless communication technologies, and formulating creative solutions. Design and simulate DSP algorithms for High-speed Coherent Optical DSP architectures. Develop DSP algorithm specifications, translate to fixed point design and innovate to meet system requirements. Contribute towards system modelling efforts in a cross-team setting. Work with Digital architecture designers to translate fixed point model to hardware design. Collaborate with stakeholders to prototype and validate design towards optimal power and performance tradeoff in different stages of product development. Identify as a Team-player and is motivated in contributing to various project goals. Have great communication skills and demonstrated willingness to collaborate as well as work independently to deliver quality designs. Qualifications Education Requirement Bachelors, Masters, OR PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field with 4+ years of relevant experience. Experience or exposure with Fixed point design experience is necessary to be considered for this role. Minimum Qualifications 1+ years of experience with Communication System modeling and Digital Signal Processing algorithms development. 2+ years of experience in Wireless or Optical Communications DSP design. 1+ years of experience with performance and power tradeoffs. Proficient in Matlab or C/C++. Additional Preferred Qualifications Track record of results in the form of publications or patents. Benefits Statement Here at Intel, we invest in our people. Beyond health, dental, and retirement benefits, Intel’s benefits package includes 14 paid holidays per calendar year, three weeks of paid vacation, four-week paid sabbatical every four years of employment, family planning care including adoption and fertility assistance, and over 45 diverse employee resource groups for networking and advocacy. Intel also offers employees five bonuses per year dependent on overall company and personal performance, and an employee stock purchase program. Inside this Business Group Intel Labs is the company's world-class, industry leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units. Job Description Join a team of researchers at the Intel Software, System and Architecture Research of Intel Labs at Hillsboro, Oregon or Santa Clara, California, responsible for research on future wireless and optical technologies. An important part of this research involves innovation in optical and wireless communication, implementing them on simulation and prototyping platforms, conducting experiments, and collecting and analyzing the data to support the research and development. The intern is expected to contribute to developing wireless and optical communication system models, to explore the design space of wireless system and architecture for the future, formulating creative solutions, and conducting experiments on research problems. Also, the ideal candidate must have excellent communication skills and a demonstrated ability to work independently on occasions when required. Job Description Looking for a fun, challenging and rewarding role at Intel? Come and join us. The Xeon performance architecture team is looking for a Performance Architect to join their team. The team is responsible for architectural exploration, evaluation of design alternatives, performance projections, power vs. performance trade-offs, and performance validation support for data center products. This job involves developing and using state of the art modeling, simulation, and projection technology to deliver Xeon CPU products with industry leading performance and power attributes. The ideal candidate will need to have a strong background in computer architecture, micro-architecture, performance analysis, and software engineering. A background in one or more of the following areas is also strongly desired: CPU and system-on-chip (SoC) architecture, cache hierarchies, integrated logic blocks, accelerators, on- and off-die coherent interconnects, memory, I/O, and core architecture. Behavioral Traits That We Are Looking For Strong problem solving, debugging, multi-tasking, and brainstorming skills. Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to work in a dynamic and team-oriented environment. The ability to distill complex ideas into well-articulated and understandable messages. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of schoolwork, classes, research, and/or relevant previous job(s). A Bachelor’s degree with 3+ years of relevant experience, Master’s degree with 2+ years of relevant experience, or a PhD degree. A degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related degree with a demonstrated ability to meet the job requirements. Your Experience Should Be In The Following Areas Computer architecture and/or microarchitecture Performance modeling Software engineering Preferred Qualifications That Will Make You Stand Out Experience in one or more of the following areas: accelerators, on- and off-die coherent interconnects, memory, I/O, cache hierarchies Research, publications, and/or patents related to computer architecture Experience with performance use cases, workloads, and/or benchmarks Hands-on experience with hardware, esp. server platforms and/or server workloads Internal and external customer engagements Hardware and software debug skills Software engineering practices (test driven development, code coverage, JIRA task management) Inside this Business Group In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power Intel’s products. From development, to integration, validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s Law and groundbreaking innovations. DEG is Intel’s engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as well as other engineering teams. As a critical provider of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient and effective manner. Job Description Intel is a global leader, creating world-changing technology that enables progress and enriches lives. We are at the intersection of several technology inflections - artificial intelligence, 5G network transformation, and the rise of the intelligent edge- that together will shape the future of technology. Intel's Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) has been delivering industry leading custom logic solutions to customers since inventing the world's first programmable logic device in 1984. The mission of PSG is to drive the future for FPGA and Intel® eASIC™ technology/solutions around the globe. Within PSG, you'll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds/engineers in the world. PSG has the best-in-market FPGA with 2X better fabric performance per watt over the competition, these devices leverage heterogeneous 3D system-in-package technology and 10nm SuperFin Technology. PSG is committed to aggressively expand our position for a broad range of market segments. The PSG Performance-Power team is seeking a motivated Manager to join our team to work on the cutting-edge FPGA performance/watt optimization. As a manager, set priorities for the team, get results across boundaries, ensure an inclusive work environment, develop employees, and manage performance. Responsibilities in this position include, but are not limited to: Meet product performance and power requirements for Intel's FPGAs. Post-silicon Performance and power optimization to achieve best in class performance/watt. Product definition to provide the best performance-power offerings to meet broad customer requirements. Design, circuit, and process debug on cutting edge technology. Develop and debug complex software programs to convert design validation vectors and drive complex test equipment. Tests, validates, modifies, and redesigns circuits to guarantee component margin to specification. Analyze customer returns. Create and apply concepts for optimizing component production relative to both quality and cost constraints. Plan and schedule daily tasks, develops solutions to problems. Self-motivated and a problem solver. You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Qualifications Minimum Education Requirement Bachelors or Master's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or related degree. Minimum Requirements 8+ years of industry experience. Experience in Static timing analysis. Experience in Performance-power optimization. Experience in circuits and logic design methodology. Preferred Qualifications FPGA experience. Scripting language Perl or Python. Silicon testing/validation experience. Experience device physics. Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. Job Description In this position as a Graphics Hardware Physical Design Engineer, you will be part a world class IP physical design team developing groundbreaking high-performance GPU IPs that are targeted for high-end graphics, gaming, artificial intelligence, media processing and more. Job Description Intel’s Programable Solutions Group is seeking a Hardware Security Architect with FIPS 140 Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) experience. The qualified candidate will be familiar with all aspects of the development of products that must achieve CMVP certification. The candidate shall have experience in defining, developing, or validating products with security content that combine hardware and firmware elements. The preferred candidate will have a strong working knowledge of the FIPS 140-3 specification, experience working with products that progress through both CAVP certification for algorithms and entropy sources, and with products undergoing CMVP certification. Job responsibilities include: performing architecture, design and implementation reviews to ensure the product will be capable of achieving CMVP certification; creation and maintenance of required documents that support the CAVP, Entropy Source and CMVP certification activities; managing communications between Intel, Customers, and the 3rd party labs during the CMVP process. Additional responsibilities include: close tracking of any changes that are made to the CMVP, especially as it evolves to incorporate support for post-quantum computing cryptographic algorithms, and communications to the development team regarding the details of such algorithm implementations that are essential to FIPS and NIST compliance; developing project timelines for CAVP, and CMVP certifications; training of other Intel team members on the requirements implicit and explicit within FIPS 140-3 and the associated implementation guidance documents. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or related field with 12+ years of relevant experience or MS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or related field with 8+ years of relevant experience 8+ years of experience working on hardware security Preferred Qualifications Experience defining products that were designed to achieved FIPS CMVP certification Experience in FPGA Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. Job Description The world is transforming - and so is Intel. Here at Intel, we believe the world needs technology that can enrich the lives of every person on earth. The Advanced Architecture Development Group (AADG) is a CPU Core development team. Validation of a Power Management IP or feature, either directly or at the system level. Minimum 3 years' experience with writing validation plans and software to implement those validation plans. Minimum 1 year experience with UNIX or Linux. Preferred Qualifications Minimum 1 year experience with Power Management computer architecture. Minimum 1 year experience with Python, C++ and/or Verilog programming experience. Minimum 3 years' experience with validation or testing experience, especially in a silicon design team. Job Description The mission of Intel’s Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) is to drive the future for Field-Programmable Gate Array (FPGAs) and Structured Application Specific Integrated Circuit (ASICs) technology/solutions around the globe. With the Performance & Power Team, you'll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the world as we work across the Programmable Solutions Engineering team to extend our Performance per Watt leadership across all product families and variants. As a key member of PSG (Programmable Solution Group) Power team, you will be responsible for full chip power analysis and optimization. Responsibilities include power analysis, power model generation and optimization. In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (Design, Planning, Package, Platform) and commit product power to meet business goals. You will also develop flows to enable efficient and accurate power analysis, including workload- and profile-dependent scenarios. If you have a passion for power modeling and optimization, we would love to talk with you. Job Description The mission of Intel's Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) is to drive the future of FPGAs and Structured ASIC technology around the globe. As part of the Performance and Power Team, you'll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the world as we work across the Programmable Solutions Engineering (PSE) team to achieve Performance per Watt leadership for every product in our broad portfolio. As Low Power Design Engineer, you will have the opportunity to perform full chip and sub-system level power analysis and optimization. You’ll have the opportunity to set power targets, analyze pre-silicon power, oversee power model generation and methodology, and identify power optimization opportunities. In this high-impact role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (Design, Planning, Package, Platform). You will help develop flows to enable efficient and accurate power analysis, including workload- and profile-dependent scenarios. If you have a passion for low power design and optimization, we would love to talk with you! Qualifications Education Requirement Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. jobDescription: Job Description Come join the Intel Validation Engineering IVE team for silicon validation! In this internship, you will be working as part of a post silicon validation team across all Intel products IVEs role at Intel is to ensure no Hardware or Firmware bugs escape to customers. Responsibilities May Include But Are Not Be Limited To Validating design and microarchitectural implementation and assumptions Creating, enhancing or supporting software tools to improve validation quality and debug capabilities Automating validation tasks in order to improve efficiency Validating signal quality of SOC IOs eg USB4 using a mix of circuit debug hooks and precise measurement equipment like Oscilloscopes and JBerts Performing data analysis of analog measurements and using statics to determine production quality or to find trends as part of debug Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or PhD degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience. Job Description Come and be a part of the team creating SoC and chip-set designs and products for Intel Architecture. This position is a role within the Chipsets Silicon Group SOC Front-End Design team, building SoC products for client and server markets. In this position, the Engineer will perform integration and validation of IP designs at the SOC level. The work will include features and behaviors fundamental to the platform, as well as interoperability with the other IPs and blocks in the SOC and platform. The engineer will work with, and gain exposure to, specialist teams and engineers including full-chip, micro-architecture, validation architecture, emulation modeling and validation, IP design, and structural/physical design; will gain exposure on platform architecture, design, and features; and will participate in debug at various level of the hierarchy. Responsibilities In This Role May Include Oversees definition, design, verification, and documentation for SoC (System on a Chip) development. Determines architecture design, logic design, and system simulation. Defines module interfaces/formats for simulation. Performs Logic design for integration of cell libraries, functional units and subsystems into SoC full chip designs, Register Transfer Level coding, and simulation for SoCs. Contributes to the development of multidimensional designs involving the layout of complex integrated circuits. Performs all aspects of the SoC design flow from high-level design to synthesis, place and route, timing and power to create a design database that is ready for manufacturing. Analyzes equipment to establish operation infrastructure, conducts experimental tests, and evaluates results. May also review vendor capability to support development. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. This is an entry level position and will be compensated accordingly. Minimum Qualifications The candidate must have a Bachelor's degree in in Electrical/Electronics Engineering (EE), Computer Engineering (CE), or Computer Science CS -OR- a Master's degree in Electrical Engineering (EE), Computer Engineering (CE), or Computer Science CS and 1+ years of work experience in: System Verilog OVM or UVM or Object-Oriented Programming (OOP). Logic design or micro-architecture fundamentals. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of standard bus protocols like PCI or IOSF or AHB. Knowledge of C/C++ or Perl scripting. Inside this Business Group In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power Intel’s products. From development, to integration, validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s Law and groundbreaking innovations. DEG is Intel’s engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as well as other engineering teams. As a critical provider of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient and effective manner. Job Description Come and join us. Intel is seeking highly qualified candidates to join our Ethernet Products Group (EPG), part of the Network and Edge Group (NEX), as a Pre-Silicon Verification Engineer. Within Intel's EPG join a creative team of silicon engineers dedicated to designing the hardware technologies that network the leading cloud service and telecommunication datacenters. You will join a close-knit team responsible for building efficient and effective constrained random verification environments that exercise designs through their corner cases and verify that the design matches a golden model. Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To Responsible for the full lifecycle of verification from planning to test execution and include collecting and closing coverage. Work closely interface with architecture and design teams to understand design product requirements and develop comprehensive test plans. Conduct, participate in test plan and test reviews, develop verification components, and tests and triage failures. Mentor and provide guidance to junior verification engineers in the execution of their tasks. Qualifications Candidates must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Requirements listed below would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research. Education Requirement Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics, or related field plus 4 years of industry work experience Minimum Qualifications 3 + years of experience verifying complex designs both at the component and full chip level 3+ years of experience in architecting and developing testbenches and verification components like bus functional models and scoreboards/checkers 2+ years of experience in SystemVerilog based UVM, OVM, VMM or related object oriented, and coverage driven ASIC verification methodology. Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics, or related field plus 3 years of industry work experience Experience in verifying complex designs both at the component and full chip level Experience with TCP IP Experience with Remote Direct Memory Access protocols eg iWARP or RoCE Experience in Ethernet Networking verification or logic design Experience in software development and scripting Inside this Business Group The Network & Edge Group brings together our network connectivity and edge into a business unit chartered to drive technology end to end product leadership. Job Description PSG's Hardware Engineering organization is looking for Senior technical lead to join us to define next generation verification strategy and architecture to tackle challenges of the future in developing FPGA and Transceiver products of Programmable Solution group. Candidate will be the focal point across organizational partnerships in Architecture, Design, Firmware developers and Validation teams within Intel across different sites. Your responsibilities will include but not limited to: Define and enhance methodologies for pre-silicon validation of high complexity FPGA and Transceiver chiplets improving the overall quality, efficiency and velocity of the pre-silicon validation team. Interact closely with the architecture and design teams, influencing product definition, implementation and verification. Create, define and develop all levels of verification environment and test suites. Responsible for the development of methodologies, execution of verification test plans, test sequences and directed tests. Job Description Principal Engineers at Intel are active technical leaders inside and outside the company. Activities include participation in major industry and academic conferences, voting membership in international standards committees, generation of patents and technical papers. Our graphics validation and verification experts are responsible for analyzing graphics hardware architectural specifications and defining feature requirements. We ensure that design implementations meet functional and performance requirements-such as physical and structural design constraints-as well as proprietary design rules and other quality criteria. In order to reach power, performance and other targets, we validate graphics hardware and implement design modifications and optimizations. As part of our team, you will help: Execute and debug hardware simulations. Identify and close design and environment defects including bug fixes requiring manual ECOs (gate-level netlist edits). Characterize and analyze performance and power results. Execute ASIC logic synthesis flows to assess progress towards timing and area objectives. Debug graphics hardware in emulation and silicon hardware environments. Qualifications Minimum Requirements: Knowledge of Graphics pipeline. Knowledge of modern validation techniques including UVM including constraint random capabilities, coverage driven validation methodology. Experience with EDA vendors. Leadership capabilities. Industry experience of 20+ years. Mentoring and recruiting new talent. Inside this Business Group The focus of Accelerated Computing Systems and Graphics (AXG) is to accelerate our execution in strategic growth areas of high-performance computing and graphics. AXG is chartered with delivering high performance computing and graphics solutions (IP, Software, Systems), for both integrated and discrete segments across client, enterprise and data center. Our mission is to make zeta-scale computing accessible to every human on the planet by the end of this decade and to entertain, educate and connect billions of people with buttery smooth visual experiences. Job Description About Structured ASIC Team: The Structured ASIC team at Intel is seeking a seasoned Silicon Platform Architect to define and lead our strategies toward next generation Structured ASIC (SASIC) platforms and arrays aimed at Datacenter, Wireless, Military, and other markets. This is an excellent opportunity to join a highly inclusive and talented team of hardware and software designers and architects that has brought Structured ASIC to market as a separate company (eASIC), then acquired by Intel in 2018 to join the Programmable Solutions Group (Intel’s FPGA unit, formerly Altera). The team is focused on extending the well-known Intel FPGA portfolio with Structured ASIC technology that offers FPGA customers significantly improved cost and power/performance by customizing few metal layers on predefined arrays. Intel has already successfully brought to market 4 generations of SASIC technology and is currently developing next generation architectures. About The Role An Intel Principal Engineer is a high-ranking technical role, with high visibility at all levels within the Programmable Solutions Group. Responsibilities include: define core architecture of SASIC, including logic, memory, routing fabric, DFT; proposes new areas for development based on advanced technical judgment and knowledge of Intel's process technology roadmap; is role model and mentor for less senior technical contributors. May represent Intel as a technical advisor or spokesman on internal and external activities. The ideal candidate for this role has demonstrated a track record for innovating and developing Silicon Platform architectures such as FPGA or other regular structures such as Vector Processing arrays. Responsibilities Collaborate with domain experts across Intel PSG to study the fast-evolving SASIC requirements. Innovate new concepts and drive new features leading to world class Perf/W solutions ensuring best Total Cost Ownership (TCO) for our customers. Help set the direction of the architecture requirements ensuring power and cost efficient SASIC solutions across various workloads and owning core architecture strategies. Closely collaborate with Hardware (Circuit) and Software (Design Automation) design teams Understand and own the key requirements from Customers, in collaboration with the Customer Engineering team Proactively identify and resolve problems upstream. Job Description This is an exciting time to join Intel as a Principal NAND Validation Engineer! What You'll Be Doing Validation of NAND components from the component feasibility stage through the production ramp. Develop test strategies and test plans for NAND feature and characterization validation. Make a significant contribution to design engineering to design-in high quality. Review details of test plans, test code, validation results, analysis, and coverage. Investigate and resolve complex issues related to the NAND design, trims, or systems integration. Lead technical teams in challenging issue resolution during development and production. Mentor mid-career engineers in NAND operation and validation techniques. Autonomously plan and schedule own daily tasks, develops solutions to problems utilizing formal education and judgment. The Ideal Candidate Will Demonstrate The Following Led technical teams and provided mentoring. The position is associated with the sale of the NAND business to SK Hynix aligning to Phase 2 of the transaction. Employees aligned to Phase 2 will continue to be employed by Intel developing NAND technology and components. Phase 2 of the transaction is expected to close in March 2025 at which time employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition employment to Solidigm, a stand-alone US subsidiary of SK Hynix headquartered in San Jose, California with offices world-wide. Solidigm is a leading global supplier of NAND flash memory solutions, led by Robert (Rob) B. Crooke as CEO, previously senior vice president and general manager of Intel’s Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group. To read more, see: https://www.intc.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/1513/intel-sells-ssd-business-and-dalian-facility-to-sk-hynix Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar discipline and 12+ years of experience. Industry experience in product development of NAND Components, or very similar technologies. In-depth technical knowledge of current industry common NAND features. Experience with formal validation methods. 5 years of experience in NAND feature validation, with hands-on experience in test case/code development, bench testing, and failure analysis. Preferred Qualifications MS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering, with an emphasis in NAND or other memory technologies and 8+ years of experience in the minimum qualifications. OR Inside this Business Group Employees in Intel's NAND Product Group deliver solutions that are transforming computing across all segments from data centers to Ultrabooks. They invent, develop, bring to market and support customers with leading-edge NAND flash memory and system level solutions such as solid state drives (SSDs). SSDs are accelerating performance for gaming enthusiasts, reducing total cost of ownership for IT managers of data centers and improving security and reliability for businesses. This dynamic group is strategically positioned to become the leading Non-Volatile Memory solution supplier for the compute segment and is a key to expanding markets and continuing the growth for Intel. Job Description The Team Design Enablement (DE) is one of the key pillars enabling Intel to deliver winning products. DE's mission is to enable all Intel product design teams to get to market faster with leadership products. The Process Design Kit Group (PDK) within DE delivers Intel process technology PDKs that are optimized to work with industry standard EDA tools. The Role In this position, you will be work with experts helping them to define requirements specifications for the PDKs. The specifications need to capture the requirements for the PDK components and the interoperability between the components. Especially, you will focus on generating electronically consumable specifications (for instance yaml) to enable or improve automation in component (code) development, test-plan and test-case generation, and automated regressions for a continuous integration / continuous delivery (CI/CD) DevOps development style. You will use modern scripting languages (like python) to generate and or interpret the specifications.You will assist PDK developers to establish a sustainable spec creation and maintenance process. Job Description Become a member of one of the largest engineering companies in the world! jobTitle: Product Manager, Intel Cloud Core Service Development
jobDescription: Job Description Intel's Software and Advanced Technology Group (SATG) is looking for a Product Manager to drive core service development, covering UX/portal and chargeback/billing, for Intel's Cloud Services offering. As a Product Manager, you will collaborate with Intel's software, engineering, and business operations teams to identify and define requirements for UX portal workflows to optimize Intel Cloud service experiences for developers and Intel ecosystem partners. Job responsibilities include developing requirements and roadmap planning of chargeback monetization capabilities for Intel cloud services in close collaboration with Intel cloud engineering, finance, and business operations teams. In addition, the product management role covers technical analyses of service implementation, end-user usability and experience, market analysis, competition, and service monetization. Core service concept development requires capturing and distilling complex business and technology concepts into clear and well-defined functional requirements for engineering to drive and define software development. As a SATG product manager, you will work closely with BU engineering, software architects, business operations, finance, and program managers and collaborate with SATG product managers and marketing leads. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related technical degree. At least ten years of experience in product management or product marketing. Ten years of experience working with software development teams and production deployments. Extensive experience with writing technical requirements documentation. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Preferred Qualifications: MBA degree preferred. Experience with UX web software design and development. Experience with sales, pricing, and chargeback backend processes and systems. Experience with cloud-native services, architectures, and technologies. Knowledge of Intel Core and GPU architectures. Knowledge of AI/ML technologies and HPC. Behavioral Traits: Ability to quickly understand, drive, and influence business process and technical design discussions with engineering and business stakeholders. Demonstrated communication and collaboration skills. Ability to thrive in a constantly evolving work environment with frequent new challenges and changes. The candidate must be willing to learn new technologies and share learnings with peers continually. Inside this Business Group Enable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software. Job Description The mission of Intel's Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) is to drive the future of FPGAs and Structured ASIC technology around the globe. As part of the Performance and Power Team, you'll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the world as we work across the Programmable Solutions Engineering team to achieve Performance per Watt leadership for every product in our broad portfolio. As Low Power Product Design Engineer, you will be responsible for full chip and sub-system level power analysis and optimization. In the role, the successful candidate will set power targets, provide pre-silicon power analysis, power model generation and power optimization. In this high-impact role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (Design, Planning, Package, Platform) and commit product power to meet business goals. In addition, you will help develop flows to enable efficient and accurate power analysis, including workload- and profile-dependent scenarios. If you have a passion for power optimization, we would love to talk with you! Qualifications Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, or Computer Science or related field with 8+ years of relevant experience. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience with industry-standard design tools and methodologies (UPF, Prime Time, Design Compiler, ICC, PnR, etc.). 5+ years of experience with power analysis and optimization techniques such as profiling, clock-gating, power-gating, and related EDA tools (PTPX, Redhawk, Power Artist and Spice). Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of experience with complex SoC projects at advanced process nodes (32nm and below). 3+ years of experience power optimization over full product development cycle. Experience with post-silicon power correlation. Experience in flow or tool development using Python/Perl/Tcl. Experience with FPGA and related EDA tools. Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Job Description The mission of Intel's Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) is to drive the future of FPGAs and Structured ASIC technology around the globe. As part of the Performance and Power Team, you'll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the world as we work across the Programmable Solutions Engineering team to achieve Performance per Watt leadership for every product in our broad portfolio. As Product Power Principal Engineer, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of FPGA and chiplet power optimization from device concept to production. In this high impact role, you will partner with groups across the engineering organization and with the Business Units to drive the development of PSG's power-optimized FPGAs and chiplets. You'll strongly influence process technology selection, device and multi-chip package (MCP) architecture, binning strategies, silicon design methodologies and execution, and the application of learnings from post-silicon power correlation. Responsibilities Oversee all aspects of product power from design concept to tape-in and production release Define product and sub-system level power goals, in partnership with Architecture and Design Monitor and ensure convergence to product power goals throughout product development cycle, including post-silicon Drive pre-silicon power optimization methodologies and strategies, in both front-end and back-end design stages Define and continuously improve methods for power model generation, leveraging industry best-practices and post-silicon learning Support analysis of power competitiveness, to help ensure product leadership Additional Skills Strong silicon design fundamentals and deep expertise in design closure methodologies for both custom and ASIC design implementations Outstanding and demonstrated communications skills, influencing skills, and ability to deliver tough messages Strong leadership skills, self-motivated, persistent, and resilient with the ability to operate in face of ambiguity Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, or Computer Science or related field with 12+ years of relevant experience 5+ years of experience with industry-standard design tools and methodologies (Prime Time, Design Compiler, ICC, PnR, etc.) 5+ years of experience with power analysis and optimization techniques such as profiling, clock-gating, power-gating, and related EDA tools 5+ years of experience leading a high-performing team of senior technical professionals Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of experience with complex SoC projects at advanced process nodes (32nm and below) 3+ years of experience overseeing power optimization over full product development cycle Strong understanding of System and SoC power architecture Experience with FPGA and related EDA tools Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. jobDescription: Job Description Come intern for one of the largest semiconductor companies in the world. The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) summer internship program is an immersive experience for students looking to build their technical skill and learn about Intel's FPGA business. About The Programmable Solutions Group PSG is responsible for Intel's programmable logic devices and forms part of Intel's Data Platform's Group. About This Role Students hired into this program will spend 10-12 weeks working with the Programmable Solutions Group alongside one of our world-class teams. Internship assignments will range from working with our customer experience group, business groups, strategy and marketing teams. All internship projects will be technical and give you exposure to PSG's product portfolio and business processes. Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To Work on challenging technical projects that help drive critical business and organizational goals. Learn about Intel's FPGA products and business. Build a robust technical and business acumen. Attend intern exclusive events that provide countless professional development and networking opportunities. Receive coaching and mentoring from our internal network of professionals. The Ideal Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits Knowledge of how to effectively balance technical skills with relationship-building skills. Knowledge of how to drive for results, a passion to win, the desire to collaborate and knowledge of how to build strong, influential relationships. Communication skills (oral and written). Job Description As part of Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) Quality and Reliability Engineering, the position of Quality Management Systems Engineer is responsible for helping drive Product Quality, Process Improvement, Quality Systems management, and Product Lifecycle (PLC) compliance for PSG products: FPGAs, structured ASICs, SW, and IP. Job Description Multimodal Dialog and Interactions Lab(MDI) in Intelligent Systems Research Division, Intel Labs focuses on inter-disciplinary research spanning Conversational AI and Cognitive Computing technologies to create Human/AI collaborative systems that can amplify human potential and create sustainable and transparent Multimodal AI solutions. We utilize multi-modal signals (e.g. vision, audio, speech, language) and human in the loop methods to create Human in the loop AI systems for situated understanding, multimodal dialog and interactions. We conduct fundamental and applied research in the context of vertical domains including manufacturing, education, enterprise, and assistive computing. Intel Labs is an industry-leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline, product innovations, and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units. MDI is looking for an Intern with experience in deep learning for language and vision systems who can help with the research being conducted in one or more of MDI's projects. The successful candidate will be working on the topic of continual learning systems in specific vertical domains like education and/or enterprise collaboration domain. In this position you will have the opportunity to conduct research on building tools and proof of concepts for continual learning systems. You will be running experiments utilizing representation learning, clustering, active learning and relevance feedback based learning methods. If needed, you will be researching fundamental concepts and methods for mixed-initiative interactive systems, building and evaluating systems and proofs-of-concept that will allow for the deployment of scalable approaches in real settings. This research will enable validation of the ideas and the publication of findings in both internal and external venues. The Successful Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits Excellent verbal and written communication skills What We Offer We give you opportunities to transform technology and create a better future, by delivering products that touch the lives of every person on earth. As a global leader in innovation and new technology, we foster a collaborative, supportive, and exciting environment where the brightest minds in the world come together to achieve exceptional results. We offer a competitive salary and financial benefits such as bonuses, life and disability insurance, opportunities to buy Intel stock at a discounted rate, and Intel stock awards (eligibility at the discretion of Intel Corporation). We provide benefits that promote a healthy, enjoyable life: excellent medical plans, wellness programs, and amenities, time off, recreational activities, discounts on various products and services, and much more creative perks that make Intel a Great Place to Work We're constantly working on making a more connected and intelligent future, and we need your help. Change tomorrow. Start today. This is an internship position and compensation will be given accordingly. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience would be obtained through a combination of prior education level classes, and current level school classes, projects, research, and relevant previous job and/or internship experience. Minimum Qualifications The candidate must be pursuing a Master’s degree or a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any related field. 1+year experience in below areas: Deep Learning, i.e. Natural Language Processing, Dialog Systems, Natural Language Generation, Multimodal Representation Learning Working knowledge of widely utilized AI frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, TensorFlow, Keras, Caffe) Python and/or C++ languages, and Linux OS Preferred Qualifications 1+ year experience in building NLP systems Knowledge of novel paradigms beyond supervised learning, such as weakly supervised multimodal learning, continual learning approaches, and unsupervised methods Experience in Multimodal Representation Learning-based techniques at the intersection of Speech, Vision, and Dialog Systems Knowledge of NLP techniques such as natural language understanding, dialog management and natural language generation Knowledge of Signal Processing and Speech Understanding techniques such as Speaker Identification and Diarization 1+ year experience with Human-Computer Interaction methods and best practices Knowledge of Explainability and Interpretability methods and techniques for deep learning. Familiarity with Intel OpenVino and RealSense technologies Inside this Business Group Intel Labs is the company's world-class, industry leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units. Job Description Intel Labs is an industry-leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline, product innovations, and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high-risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units. Intelligent Systems Research Lab (ISR) is focused on multi-disciplinary research spanning ethnography, design, HCI, and AI to create Human/AI collaborative systems that can amplify human potential and create sustainable and transparent AI solutions. We utilize multi-modal signals (e.g. vision, audio, speech, language, RF) and AI to infer and predict human state and actions and enable physically situated dialog and interactions. We conduct this research in the context of vertical domains including manufacturing, education, enterprise, and assistive computing for people with disabilities. ISR is looking for an Intern with experience in the deep learning domain who can help with the research being conducted in ISR's focus areas. The successful candidate will be working specifically on the topic of multimodal action recognition and task tracking in specific vertical domains. In this position, you will have the opportunity to conduct research on fundamental AI techniques related to action recognition and task tracking - with particular attention to domain where typical big data approaches cannot be applied. Working with real data, you will be researching fundamental concepts and methods spanning deep learning, computer vision, and mixed-initiative dialog systems, building and evaluating systems and proofs-of-concept that will allow for the deployment of scalable approaches in real settings. This research will enable validation of the ideas and the publication of findings in both internal and external venues. This is an internship position and compensation will be given accordingly. Job Description Initiates the design, development, execution and implementation of scientific research projects to fuel Intel's growth in the areas of computing, communication, technology and manufacturing and new business opportunity. Investigates the feasibility of applying scientific principles and concepts to potential inventions and products typically 7+ years prior to landing on a product roadmap. Plans and executes laboratory research. Maintains substantial knowledge of stateoftheart principles and theories, and contributes to scientific literature and conferences. May participate in development of intellectual property. May coordinate interdepartmental activities and research efforts. Typically holds a PhD. The Successful Candidate Is Expected To Maintain substantial knowledge of state-of-the-art principles and theories. Contribute to scientific literature via papers and presentations. Initiate the design, development, and implementation of security-related scientific research projects to fuel Intel's growth in the areas of data processing and network communications related to new and existing business opportunities. Use scientific methods to investigate the feasibility of novel concepts typically 5-7+ years prior to landing on a product roadmap. Validate ideas through prototyping, including systems software (Operating Systems, Virtual Machine Monitors, compilers, runtime libraries), CPU simulations, FPGAs and working with CPU/GPU/XPU ISA/hardware/microcode extensions. Participate in development of intellectual property related to their research. Independent thinker and team player to move state of the art technologies forward. The candidate should possess strong analytic skills and ability to work in a dynamic and team-oriented environment. This is an entry level position and compensation will be given accordingly. Qualifications You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes and project work, internships, military training, and/ or work experience. Minimum Qualifications The candidate must possess a PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field, with a focus on platform security, core architecture, accelerators, system software, or memory management. Preferred Qualifications Experience/knowledge in one or more of the following: Trustworthy computing, anti-malware, compartmentalization, microservices for cloud computing, 1+ years of experience in Verilog / RTL experience for developing low level CPU pipeline enhancements 1+ years of experience in modifying the Linux kernel 2+ years of experience in security and/or cryptography 1+ year of experience with microservices or Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) orchestration frameworks and runtimes Inside this Business Group Intel Labs is the company's world-class, industry leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units. Job Description Join Intel-and build a better tomorrow. Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a vision to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. So, join us-and help us create the next generation of technologies that will shape the future for decades to come. Intel Labs is the company's world-class, industry leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high-risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units. In this position, you will be contributing to Intel's chip-to-chip photonic research with a strong emphasis on practical application to future generation products. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, circuit architecture research, design and prototyping of electrical high-speed IO in CMOS technology to drive discrete optical devices, low-jitter high-speed clock generation, recovery and distribution, low-power and variation-tolerant mixed-signal circuits, and advanced techniques for behavioral link modeling. You will also be involved in advanced signaling architecture development including modulation, equalization and coding. What We Offer We give you opportunities to transform technology and create a better future, by delivering products that touch the lives of every person on earth. As a global leader in innovation and new technology, we foster a collaborative, supportive, and exciting environment where the brightest minds in the world come together to achieve exceptional results. We offer a competitive salary and financial benefits such as bonuses, life and disability insurance, opportunities to buy Intel stock at a discounted rate, and Intel stock awards (eligibility at the discretion of Intel Corporation). We provide benefits that promote a healthy, enjoyable life: excellent medical plans, wellness programs, and amenities, time off, recreational activities, discounts on various products and services, and much more creative perks that make Intel a Great Place to Work. We're constantly working on making a more connected and intelligent future, and we need your help. Change tomorrow. Start today Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience would be obtained through a combination of prior education level classes, and current level school classes, projects, research, and relevant previous job and/or internship experience. Minimum Qualifications The candidate must possess a Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering or related discipline. 2+ years of experience in an industry research group. Publication history in top-tier circuit conferences and journals. 2+ years of experience in low-power analog and/or mixed-signal circuits and deep sub-micron Complementary Metal-Oxide Semiconductor (CMOS) chip design and research experience in multi-gigabit I/O circuit design concepts. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of photonic device fundamentals and optical fiber termination and packaging. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units. Job Description Have you taken a career break and had your resume rejected because of your resume gap? Intel is offering 16-week paid returnships for experienced professionals ready to return to the workforce. If you have taken a break of at least one year for the following reasons we welcome, you to apply: Starting or raising a family Military service/military spouse Community service/volunteer work Caring for a family member or self Teaching At Intel we are excited to have a Return-to-Work program because we appreciate the skills individuals who are returning to work can offer. This program offers you a chance to revamp your skills, update your resume with new experience, and make connections with others transitioning back to the workforce. This position is hybrid during the 16-week returnship program. The goal of this program is to hire individuals who were successful throughout the program duration. A full-time offer will be hybrid. By applying to this posting your resume and profile will become visible to Intel's Recruiting team, and will allow them to consider you for current/future job openings aligned with the skills and positions listed below. You'll be considered for multiple roles within the Design Enablement team of our Technology Development Organization. Responsibilities may be quite diverse and are technical in nature. U.S. experience and education requirements will vary significantly depending on the unique needs of the job. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Candidates must have been out of the paid workforce for at least one year. Bachelors or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field with Industry experience in at least one the following areas: Foundry design rules and layout concepts on advanced process nodes Experience with layout and layout tools on chips Design rule checking (DRC) and Layout vs Schematic (LVS) Familiarity with scripting or programming languages, such Perl, Python, TCL Analog Circuit Design Device physics DRC/LVS/Extraction runsets Custom or ASIC layout design CMOS silicon process technology OR VLSI design. EDA Tools: Cadence Virtuoso or Custom Compiler Inside this Business Group As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art -- from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology Development and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore’s Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth. Job Description As an RTL Design Engineer within the Design Creation and Debug Group, you will be part of a team to develop a cutting-edge FPGA IP solution created for an emerging market segment. Within the Design Creation and Debug Group, you have many opportunities to work on the RTL underpinnings Intel PSG's System-on-Chip integration tool, Platform Designer, FPGA Debug Environment Tools such as Signal Tap and System Console and next generation FPGA-based soft processors. Your career is not limited to the starting project you are hired for right now. The goal of this team is to enable customers to implement powerful embedded hardware systems in a straightforward and enjoyable manner from design creation through debugging and performance optimization. The team is responsible for development of RTL for various IPs, including the on-chip Memory Mapped Bus Interconnect (AXI/APB/AHB/Avalon), streaming protocols IPs (AXI/Avalon), debug IP and performance monitors, soft microprocessor implementations along with supporting a full stack of tools to assemble these IPs in interesting and dynamic ways. Some Larger Projects We're Undertaking Include As an RTL Design Engineer in this position, you will need to have excellent FPGA digital design skills with expertise in Verilog/System Verilog. Define, develop, and enhance FPGA prototyping and emulation capabilities Develop debug architecture for upcoming Intel FPGA devices Developing robust IPs and networks which customers use in mission critical debug environments Provide newer versions of on-chip transfer protocols aimed for high speed on HyperFlex and eASIC architectures Develop new interconnect topologies to maximize data transfer throughput over long distances Extend support for industry standard Memory Mapped and Streaming protocols Develop microprocessor and microcontroller architectures optimized for implementation on Intel FPGAs Strong written and oral communication skills Self-starter and strong problem-solving skills The RTL Design Engineer Will Have a Direct Influence On Our Customers And The Adoption Of Our Products, With Tasks Including The Following Work closely with developers across Software, IP Design and Embedded Engineering to ensure we develop design flows that meet our customers' needs Guide IP release content, and serve as a liaison with the support, field, marketing, and product planning organizations Research, define, and validate key customer use cases Create reference RTL designs Use Intel FPGA design tools like our customers to identify usability and productivity problems or missing features Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research. Qualifications Minimum: BS degree in Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering or equivalent and 6+ years of relevant industry experience Experience with digital design/Fundamentals of Verification/Hardware Debug Experience Verilog/System Verilog Preferred Qualifications FPGA architecture and design methodology FPGA timing and physical design constraints Experienced with RTL design and debug Tcl, Perl, and/or Python scripting skills Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. Job Description The Analog Circuit Design Engineer designs, develops, modifies and evaluates complex analog and mixed signal electronic parts, components or integrated circuitry for analog and mixed signal electronic equipment and other hardware systems. This role is responsible for the design and development of electronic components. We are looking for the right person to take a Senior Analog Design role in the design and analysis of analog circuits - someone who will seize the opportunity to lead, design, and validate High Speed IO design IPs circuits such as DLL, TX, Rx, Voltage Regulators and References, High Voltage Circuit Design such as level shifters, charge pumps, and bias circuits, etc. Additional Responsibilities may include (but are not limited to): Design of analog mixed signal IP and chip layout Conduct circuit simulations and checking Complete device evaluation and characterization, Document specifications Complete prototype construction and checkout Modify and evaluate semiconductor devices and components Perform developmental and/or test work Review product requirements and logic diagrams Plan, organize, and design projects or phases of design projects. Respond to customer/client requests or events as they occur. Develop solutions to problems utilizing formal education and judgment. Qualifications Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field plus 10+ years of relevant experience or a Master's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field with 8+ years of relevant experience. experience in SOC/IP high speed IO analog/mixed signal circuit design including: In depth hands on experience in designing, testing and validating analog and/or mixed signal circuits with sub-micron CMOS technology. Strong experience in high speed IO circuit design in any of these areas: Rx, Tx, LDO, PLL, DLL, and clocking circuits. Solid understanding of deep sub-micron device physics, process technology and manufacturing. Knowledge of analog layout techniques, including floor-planning, matching, shielding and parasitic optimization. Strong background in VLSI and industry standard CAD tools for schematic capture, simulation, layout and physical verification (examples: Cadence adexl, Spectre/Ultrasim/AMS Designer /Virtuoso). Preferred Qualifications: Experience in mixed signal IP design. Good communication and leadership skills Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research. Inside this Business Group IP Engineering Group's (IPG) vision Build IPs that power Intel's leadership products and power our customer's silicon. We want to attract & retain talent who get joy in building high quality IP and share our core belief that IP is fundamental to transforming Intel's silicon design process. IPG's guiding principles will be ensuring Quality (Zero Bugs), Customer Obsession (Delight our Customers) and structured Problem Solving. We are a fearless organization transforming IP development. Job Description The mission of Intel's Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) is to drive the future for FPGAs and Structured ASICs technology/solutions around the globe. With PSG Structured ASIC Engineering IP Solutions group, you'll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds/engineers in the world as we are responsible for creating the a portfolio of IP-solutions on the Structured ASIC family of devices catering to different market segments. The Custom Structured ASIC Engineering Group within Intel Programmable Solutions Group is seeking exceptional talent for an experienced Structured-ASIC/FPGA IP Solutions Engineer to work with a diverse team designing Intel's next generation Structured ASIC (Intel eASIC) based SOCs and Customer Design solutions - someone who is passionate to improve the way we solve complex problems through teamwork or direct contributions. In this position, you would play a critical role in IP solutions for customer designs encompassing the architecture, best-in-class IP sourcing, logic design, verification and implementation of Subsystems of Custom Structured-ASIC SoCs within the Programmable Solutions Group (PSG). The candidate is expected to actively collaborate across in-house IP-engineering teams and best-in-class 3rd Party IP vendors and drive IP-solutions execution for different designs. The candidate would work closely with developers across IP Design, Verification, and Implementation engineers to ensure we develop IP and subsystems that meet our customers' needs. Candidate responsibilities include the following: Design, verification and Implementation of IPs and subsystems on Structured-ASIC (eASIC) fabric comprehending RTL coding, Integration of IPs, Synthesis, Simulation, Compilation, Timing Analysis, Power Analysis. Create reference IP and subsystem designs for eASIC implementation. Perform Subsystem Qualification for customized IP configurations for different designs. Perform design evaluations and recommend strategies to optimize designs for important design opportunities. Develop technical collateral and presentations for internal and external stakeholders. Behavioral Characteristics: Verbal and written communication skills. Independence and proven willingness to set and meet own goals. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum education requirements and minimum required qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Education Bachelor or Master's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field Minimum Qualifications 7+ years of industry experience in SOC/IP Design and Development. Preferred Qualifications Design and implementation experience in IPs such as PCIe, CXL, Wireless, Ethernet protocols would be desired. Solid understanding of hardware design, design verification, timing analysis, clock domain crossing, and lint. ASIC or FPGA design experience including Verilog/VHDL/System Verilog coding, Standard EDA flows and Synthesis tools(Design Compiler), Simulation (ModelSim/VCS/Incisive), Spyglass (CDC analysis), timing closure (Primetime), Power analysis, design optimization and on-chip debugging. Solid Tcl, Perl and/or Python scripting skills. Direct experience with integrating IPs and cross-functioning with IP teams. This position is eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. Job Description It's an exciting time to be a part of Intel's Total Rewards organization. As a Senior Consultant in Intel's Total Rewards Executive Compensation team, you will work closely with the Director of Executive Compensation and be responsible for managing executive compensation activities, including development and review of Compensation Committee materials; peer company analyses, investor engagement preparation; creation of executive job offers; design, implementation, and administration of executive compensation and benefits plans, programs, and projects. Plan/program areas may include incentive bonus plans, equity programs, profit sharing and commission plans, health and wellbeing benefits, paid time off, insurance, retirement and capital accumulation plans, and ad hoc projects as requested. Program administration includes but is not limited to the following: annual executive compensation planning and executions, executive equity plans, stock ownership compliance analysis, board of directors compensation program, and overseeing executive retention, promotion and onboarding activities. Responsibilities Will Include But Are Not Limited To Leading development, review, analysis and follow up on Compensation Committee and investor engagement activities. Preparing Intel executives for Board and external engagements. Competitive benchmarking analysis, costing and funding of plans, market analysis and recommendations, job family descriptions, job audits and analysis, job classification analysis and recommendations, establishing policies and guidelines, auditing practices against guidelines, stock and dollar budgeting, strategic scanning of the external environment, lobbying, external reporting, and vendor management. Acting as internal expert, consultant, analyst, and program manager and representing the function with Executive Leaders and HR Business Partners. Responding to customer/client requests or events as they occur. Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal education and judgement. Identifying, analyzing and leveraging appropriate data and comparisons. The Ideal Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits Analytics skills (including Excel) using advanced methodologies for data management and analysis, to merge and validate data sets, and developing sustainable models that facilitate scenario planning. Experience managing large amounts of structured and unstructured data with ability to identify trends and anomalies. Experience providing conclusions from data; preparing compelling story from findings and presenting recommendations based on holistic quantitative analyses. Understands data interdependencies and effects of assumptions used and methodology changes. Not only on the numbers, but also overall impact to a full program or group. Experience preparing presentations (PowerPoint) for senior and Board-level audiences, including necessary backup material and preparation notes. Stakeholder management, build partnerships across the organization, including HR, Finance, Legal and other functions across Intel. Experience working independently or to lead others in defining and resolving complicated problems. Attention to detail, ensuring data and analysis are complete, accurate and credible. Time management/prioritization skills/ability to handle urgent requests. Executive presence and ability to support and interact with executives at every level. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. Preferred Qualifications Finance, Accounting, Compensation, Executive Compensation background.
